text:
SHE is mine and I’m f***ing proud! #SHEisMine
.
I don’t mean to upset you with what I just saw on the news, but this needs to be talked about. A four day old baby girl was found buried alive. She was found by a couple who were burying a child they had lost and heard her cries while digging a grave. She was buried alive because she was born a girl...
.
Tens of thousands of female babies are aborted every year simply because male babies are preferred by culture. This goes beyond unequal wages and the gender inequality we face in our own country, this is a matter of unequal and unworthy of LIFE 😭 What in the actual ****?
.
I believe that we are all equals, but in the case where any gender were to reign superior, should it not be female? Just saying 🙊 Without woman, there is no man. Women give birth to men, we gift them their LIFE. Without us, they wouldn’t exist. We birth men. We grow them, WE nurture them and raise them. That’s some pretty powerful stuff. How dare my daughter be viewed as “less-than” by anyone or any culture. #WeAreEqual
.
So here I am today, putting this out here because I feel compelled to try and make a difference. I’m mad, and heart broken. We need to change the world. So let’s do it, maybe we can save some babies. Let’s start a movement ♥️
.
This is my beautiful, amazing daughter whom I value EQUALLY to my son.
SHE is mine ♥️ and I am so damn proud to call her mine #EndGenderInequality
.
Will you post a photo of you and your baby girl or just a picture of her today with the same caption as mine? “SHE is mine and I’m f***ing proud! #SHEisMine #EndGenderInequality ” and join us in our fight for change! 💪🏼 Tag us so we can share and spread our message loud and proud, that these GIRLS are OURS and we are effing PROUD! 😭♥️ @theknottedcrown |#SHEisMine♥️ Even if you don’t want to tag us, please share something! Our babies deserve a voice. These baby girls deserve to be heard.
comments: |How did we get there??? This is so terrible❤️|This is truly happening in same countries because of their culture and beliefs 😭 we are all equal and all of us should have equal rights. Proud mama of girls here 😍|I always wanted two girls and that’s exactly what I got!  I’m excited to raise them to be strong, smart & brave and for them to know their worth!  Who run the world?  GIRLS! ♥️🙌🏼🤗

text:
In 2004, former Plan International Germany Director Marianne Raven was in Nepal discussing the challenges faced by a rural community.
She saw a girl called Sharmila who didn’t have enough clothes on to keep her warm.
When Marianne asked her mother why she wasn’t being cared for, the mother replied, “Because she is a girl,” and a campaign was born.
This marked the start of a growing focus from Plan International on the needs and rights of girls that resulted in Because I am a Girl transforming girls’ lives in over 70 countries.

I personally came across @planindia
In 2014 April that was the same month I got my first salary and wanted to do something more then just spending it on me.
Great Initiative Great cause. I will always support it. ❤❤❤❤❤ I am not nominating anyone specific but all who can see this post.
#girlsgetequal
@planindia #girlsgetequalchallenge #weareequal #planindia

Each and every one of these animals would have had a different ending if they didn't liberate themselves with the help of humans.

Each and every one of these animals deserve their freedom. Just like the billions who are still stuck in the animal industry.

You can help them live their life the way it's supposed to be. Choose a plantbased lifestyle today.

Reposted from @sashafarm .

Their “would have” didn’t happen because these lucky ones were rescued. Now, they are living the lives that all beings deserve here at SASHA Farm.

(How women in countries like Bangladesh & India suffer during menstruation.)
-
Bangladeshi women suffer from menstrual problems such as dysmenorrhea, menorrhagia, light and heavy bleeding during menstruation, and irregular period and are constantly worried if their menstrual flow is not a “normal” amount. They believe that a good menstrual flow is needed to stay healthy. If the flow decreases, they think that they have “bad blood” trapped within their bodies, and if it stops altogether, they are concerned that they may have become infertile. Inability to conceive is viewed negatively in Bangladeshi society and women are subjected to psychological distress by society if they are perceived as infertile. Also, there are many social, cultural and religious taboos surrounding menstruation such as staying away from foods such as fish, eggs, meat, sour fruits, etc during menstruation. Moreover, they are often advised to stay indoors as menstrual blood may attract evil spirits,as well as stay away from their own children and families.Gynecological problems such as those related to menstruation are a major concern among Bangladeshi women, but social stigma and shame stand as a barrier against seeking proper healthcare.Yes why not we stop hating women or keep thinking that they are impure while they are on periods.As @healtheworld19 have said earlier “world would be so much better if we get to understand each other’s emotions”.Women go through a lot, they just don’t show their emotions.Why not we all stand up for women who's having troubles with their menstruation. Women are heroes,they carried us for 9 months in their womb,brought us in this beautiful world.Then why are we not taking care of them??? Spread positivity,happiness joy around the world and diminish hate.Respect Women & their bodies.💪🏼
.

text:
Today I want to have a one on one talk with you guys. I've been thinking for a while to have raw cconversations. To interact better with you guys. We all have a story that no one knows about. A past we Can't forget. A future we can't predict. Why do we always have to be STUCK IN THE MIDDLE OF NOWHERE. Why are our minds so stuffed up?. To the point we don't know what we're doing. And just with the flow, cuz that's better?. Why don't we find time for what we love the most?. Hang out with people that bring the REAL US out!?. We care too much about others, we care too much about what society thinks of us, we can't let out past go?. and we cant even stop thinking about what our future holds. ALL THESE THOUGHTS ARE WHAT WE ARE STUCK IN!. It's sad how we can't put ourselves first anymore.  If one tries to. They will either get bullied, pulled back, or be judged!. EVERYONE HERE IS HERE FOR A REASON. We are all unique. And we, ourselves need to understand this first in order to know our worth. IF YOU WANT PEACE IN THE WORLD, CREATE IT!.. Why have we stopped supporting each other?. I've so many questions.  And yet all I can do is think myself to sleep.. all these WHAT IFS, and WHYS are stuck with me. 
I want us to not only want better for us, but better for the world, better for the animals, plants, people, ourselves, our thoughts. We need to stay United.  We need to SHOW MORE LOVE. BECAUSE WE ARE ALL EQUAL. I wish I could say much more. And if you would like for me to talk on issues of the world.  I would love to. Just lemme know down below ❤
#STOPBODYSHAMING
#STARTLOVING
#YOUAREPERFRCT
#LOVEYOURSELF 
#EVERYBODYISUNIQUE
#WEAREEQUAL
#SUPPORT
#DONTHATE
#DEVOTIONFIRST
comments:
|Absolutely true! 💕 We need to stop acting “egoistic “, “jealous “ and poking our nose in every body’s business. Stop acting “over concerned” with someone’s act because that’s for sure going to hurt your own self!  We all need to be productive and creative in a positive way! Support each other for your own sake at least!🙏🏻
#createdonthate
#spreadpositivity
❤️|Accurate!.. love and support others if you want that love and respect for yourself! ❤️🙌|😍🔥

text:
Flashback to last weekends Hastings 10km, being escorted to the line by the event director on the lead bike. He came back for me after escorting the lead man to the finish. I was very happy to receive the same treatment that the winning man received. It’s a shame the journalist from the local paper decides only the winning man needed mentioning in the race report - you should probably mention the Women’s winner too right? Women just want to be treated equally. Equal pay, equal distances in sports, equal opportunities, equal respect, equal treatment #weareequal
.
.
.

text:
💓 I posted this back in Feb but like to be reminded of it as time goes by #repost⠀
⠀
Empathy, understanding and love are beautiful emotions us humans are able to give to others when hearing their stories. I think it’s important for us to take into consideration everyone’s back story through our everyday lives and work.⠀
⠀
When we get to truly know a person... their hopes, their fears, their insecurities, their hurts, their wishes, their regrets, their goals, their failures and their successes, we find it difficult not to love them once we learn what they’ve been through.⠀
⠀
We’ve all been through stuff and have vulnerabilities. There is always a reason why somebody is the way they are... lets not forget that ❤⠀⠀
⠀
⁣#worldmentalhealthday #BeKind

text:
Be real...
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
I am realizing that people like REALL so much more than posed and perfect. We can spend so much time making our feeds look just right or have the photo edited just perfect but I sincerely believe that the more authentic & real we are the more relatable we are. And the more relatable we are the better people feel. ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
We are all human. We all poop and pee and wake up with morning breath. Seriously. Think about it. Social media can cause us to feel so separated from others, as if we are so very different than the people we are following but we are all the same. We are all equal. ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
So today I celebrate those who show up real. This takes true self confidence and to me this is beautiful...
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀

text:
“Community” can come in many different forms. This past weekend, I attended a Toyota Motorhome Club rally in Indiana. Going into the event, I really just expected to enjoy conversations around our quirky little RVs, but the depth of character shared amongst attendees was incredibly refreshing. I’m left reflecting on how we always have a choice: to isolate ourselves out of self-preservation or fear, or to seek out community with a willingness to be vulnerable, open to what it will return. .
.
.
Attendees ranged in age, home-base location, political views, vocation, religious beliefs, lifestyle... I could go on and on if I wanted to focus on our differences, but I don’t. Our differences disappeared when we all met on common ground, sharing knowledge, helping each other to fix this or that on our RVs, communing around meals, and telling spirited stories or singing songs around the bonfire. Over the course of the weekend, I learned as much about these wonderful people- and myself- as I did about my motorhome. We began our three days together as strangers and drove away knowing that we had that many more friends in the world. .
.
.
This isn’t a typical volunteer-centric post, but my experience from the weekend made me realize that one of the most beautiful aspects of volunteering is the equalizing effect it has on those involved in the nonprofit community. When a person approaches a strong community with the desire to learn and contribute, those positive commonalities shadow over individuals’ differences. We can all use a little bit more of that these days!

text:
Natürlich fotografiert man immer nur dann, wenn es etwas Schönes zu sehen gibt - wir wollen aber nicht zu einem scheinheilig perfekten Bild der sozialen Medien beitragen. 🛑

Denn, wie wir alle, haben auch wir viel durch gemacht, sowohl als Paar als auch jeder einzelne für sich selbst. 
Nur weil man ein paar hundert Kilometer weit weg fährt und die Umgebung traumhaft aussieht, sind diese Themen, Wunden und Herausforderungen nicht einfach auf lautlos gestellt oder gar verschwunden. 
Also möchten wir nicht verschweigen, dass auch wir, zwischen all den schönen Momenten hier, unsere verzweifelten, traurigen, überforderten und wütenden Momente hatten. Wenn ihr euch also das nächste Mal blöd fühlen solltet, weil sich bei euch alles schwerer anfühlt als es bei anderen auf ihren Profilen aussieht, dann vergesst nicht, dass Fotos nur einen winzigen Teil des Lebens festhalten und wiedergeben können und dass nur sehr wenige behaupten können es sei einfach sie zu sein.
.
.
Wie würdet ihr auf diese Frage antworten? 
Ist es einfach Du zu sein? 🧐
.
.
.
#ineverydirection #lovewins #instagood #instalove #human #instahuman #embrace #embraceyourself #morerealityoninstagram #everyoneisbeautiful #weareequal #equal #travel #travelblog #lifeblog #explore #expedition #einfachmalmachen #scheiternerlaubt #wanderlust #wandersociety #LGBT+ #LGBT #liebwenduwillst
comments: |Es ist definitiv nicht einfach „ich“ zu sein. Denn das bedeutet auch mutig zu sein und das erfordert Kraft. Oft bin aber zu bequem um mutig zu sein, oder zu traurig, oder auch zu unsicher. Was mich im Nachhinein total ankotzt. Denn manchmal weiß ich dann gar nicht mehr wer ich bin und werde von Menschen die mich kennenlernen grundsätzlich falsch/anders eingeschätzt. Das ist anstrengend und total unnötig. Aber ich werde das ändern.  Ihr seid großartig, aber das sagte ich euch schon,ne??🤔😉 Vielen für diesen Post|Nein. Das ist nicht einfach. Aber ich versuche jeden Tag daran zu arbeiten das es einfacher wird ich selbst zu sein 💪🏼

text: Creativity is the oldest gift in the universe. The ability to observe, experience, innovate, reproduce, and create is within us all. I choose to honor this gift in a number of ways, but primarily through visual art. I think, read, dream, daydream, converse, sketch and paint. I love developing ideas in my sketchbooks and then bringing them to life on canvas. #sketchdaily #operateinyourgift #staycreative #creativeprocess #nativeamericanart #weareequal #equality #studiomojo

LGBT History Month 🏳️‍🌈 is an annual month-long observance of lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender history, and the history of the gay rights and related civil rights movements.  LGBT History Month provides role models, builds community, and represents a civil rights statement about the contributions of the LGBT community.  Currently, LGBT History Month is a month-long celebration that is specific to the United States, the United Kingdom and Canada. In the United States and Canada, it is celebrated in October to coincide with National Coming Out Day on 11 October.
▪️
▪️

text:
I went out of my comfort zone yesterday and posted my story about my introduction to teenage motherhood nearly 10 years ago. After an overwhelming amount of dms and Facebook messages I’ve decided to permanently post it to my page. I angry wrote it one night a few months ago and finally decided it was worth it to share . I’m not the only teen mom to ever be and won’t be the last and I hope sharing this will help other young moms to know they aren’t alone . Link will remain in my bio if you’re interested in the read . & please feel free to share my post in support of young moms who might feel in the same situation. We all know we aren’t alone, but i know it’s nice to read other real life stories. •
•
#teenmom #teenmothers #youngmoms #embracemotherhood #weareequal #love #motherhood #mystory #teenmomawareness #instapic #igdaily #instagood #instastory #instamom #youngmom #postpartum #thisispostpartum #birth #birthbecomesher #birthstory #photooftheday #repost #igers #bestoftheday #fraservalley #vancouver #takebackpostpartum #linkinbio #followers #following

text:
Vor Nicole habe ich nie die innere Ruhe gefunden um zu lesen. Gelesene Worte blieben nicht lange haften. 🤷🏽‍♀️
Nicole liebt Bücher und wenn sie Worte gelesen hat, dann passiert so viel bei ihr. Es ist als würde sie die Texte in sich einsaugen, umarmen, genau betrachten und für sich das Beste entnehmen. 
Mich beeindruckt immer wieder wie sie ihr Bewusstsein durch Bücher weiterentwickelt.📖 Mittlerweile schaffe ich es auch über eine lange Zeit ein Buch alleine zu lesen. .
Doch am meisten nehme ich selber mit wenn ich Nicole vorlese. Durch das laut gelesene Wort und das gemeinsame besprechen nehme nun auch ich viel mit. Wenn wir nun gemeinsam unterwegs sind, ist auch meist ein Buch an unserer Seite. 👭❤️ .
.
.
❗️aktuelles Buch : ISMAEL von Daniel Quinn❗️ Definitiv ein Buch, dass dich in deinem Bewusstsein gegenüber unserer Kultur und Zivilisation verändert.
.

text: Langsam ärgert es mich, wenn Menschen allein nur durch kurze Haare gleich eine Einbindung machen das ich ein Kerl wäre? NEIN! Ich verstehe nicht wie man allein durch das Aussehen urteilen kann. 🤦🏻‍♀️ ich mein hab ich einen Bart, habe ich eine männliche Stimme, ich hab nicht mal männliche Gesichts Konturen, also wie kann man da sagen das ich ein Kerl bin! Wenn man es nicht weiß oder sich nicht sicher ist, fragt bitte lieber nach bevor ihr jemanden falsch ausruft! Es gibt keine Normalität, wir alles sind verschieden was uns zur individuellen Persönlichkeiten macht. #dissapointed  #frustrated #bewildering #whatisnormal #whoweare #forourselves #beyourself #loveyourself #selfcare #dontletaffectyou #humansareweird #weareequal #differentpersonality #tomboystyle #tomboyhair #peaceofmind #loyalty #toleranz #feminist #feminism #grlpwr #fuckthepatriarchy

text: Often times we focus on empowering #women or #men separately but not often enough we put our efforts to understand both sexes and how women and men have been subjected to different types of thinking and values that are now an issue for the society that we want for ourselves. The same way that women have been mistreated, under-appreciated and used, men have also suffer from the different symptom of a sick society. Instead of taking parts I believe we should educate and understand each other more, support in equal measurements and leave behind the stereotypes that only put us apart. As a kid I didn’t grow up with a male figure, instead my house was full of strong, independent women that tought me #empowerhumans we all deserve it! 📷 @_thatgirlbooter ⚡️#bethechange #useyourpowertoempower #empower #weareequal

Herzlich Willkommen 🙋🏽‍♀️
... ja so ein Anfang ist nicht einfach, muss aber mal gemacht werden,👣 wenn auch etwas holperig 😊. Wir also zusammen 👭!
Laura vor der Kamera, Ich hoffentlich hauptsächlich dahinter 😏 und eine Seite auf der wir Ländern, Themen und Emotionen auf den Grund gehen.

Zumindest wollen wir es versuchen, man weiß ja nie wie man dann so auf Knopfdruck funktioniert. 
Also hier die Gelegenheit uns zu begleiten und wenn es auch beim scheitern ist 🤷🏽‍♀️, dann wären wir schließlich auch um eine Erkenntnis reicher.💪
Laura und Nicole 👯‍♀️

text:
When you look at a painting, you don't criticize each brush stroke, you appreciate the piece as a whole. .
.
I heard this and thought it was also relative to body image. .
.
People are so quick to judge parts of a body, instead of just accepting that person as a whole. .
.
It seems as though body shaming has become more common than body positivity. .
.
Let's change that.  Make it your goal to compliment someone today!❤ .
.
#selflove #acceptance #bekind #bodyacceptance #inclusive #weareequal #loveoneanother #smile #bethechange #makeadifference #allbodiesarebeautiful #loveyourself #breakthemold

text:
Du siehst die Welt nicht so wie sie ist, du siehst die Welt wie du bist
🌹
.

This Foto is taken for few years ago. the time we had a huge wave of human being run away from the terrible war or injustice ... coming to Europe/ Germany 🇩🇪 in hope for a safer  life .
I worked ( unsalaried) in different cultural projects , with different groups and institutions. I had the honor to meet a lot of beautiful souls .  Color 🌈 their grey days a little and bring smiles in faces.. was my biggest happiness .
📸 
Foto: A refugee- camp in Hamburg and 2 Engels 👼 👼 .
💕💕
.

text:
I wanted to do a post about the impeachment proceedings (which is finally happening!!!!) but I couldn’t figure out a good saying or something so I think I might write a poem and post it tomorrow instead.
Anyway, this is a picture I’ve had for a while but never got around to posting, I got the words from @wanpoetry and it’s really enlightening y’all should watch it. 
White Privilege is something a lot of people want to pretend doesn’t exist. And when they acknowledge it theyre like “oh this is ALL the racism”....but it isn’t. Like not even close. 
What do y’all think is gonna happen with the impeachment investigation? 
Personally I think they will impeach him but he might get acquitted so who knows( if that statement confused you feel free to DM me I’ll be more than happy to explain)
~Mariam❤️ #weareallhumans #blacklivesmatter #nativelivesmatter #lgbtqlivesmatter #loveeverybody #loveeveryone #weareequal #lgbtq #equality #feminism #feminist #intersectionalfeminism #intersectionalfeminist #fuckdresscodes #fuckdresscode

text:
"Growing up I had no idea I’d be as resilient as I am today. Shame, embarrassment and insecurities embraced me the way I wished my peers would. I never seen anyone like myself growing up. So, I decided to become an example without a guide. My skin encompasses the strength of all the pain ridicule provides. It’s something so beautiful, so unique and so authentic. I couldn’t ever imagine a life where I wasn’t myself, I’m glad I don’t have to. I’m grateful to be me." — @lyricallydiverse captured by @sophiekietzmann
Via @girlgaze ‼Follow @_black_women_matter_ ‼

text:
@eq.cixno.

Shoutouts to @zeek805 @xai.vfx @kaylee_official_ @_good._.vibezzz @eq.asp. 
I’ll leaving the general gaming community for a duration of 6 months. I may be back for Christmas but no promises! I’ll always have a place for this in my heart! Watch this whole thing. Leading @equal_org had a lot of doubt in my heart as to what a real friend is and I realized it’s not about doing everything for you; it’s about the ones there for your lowest points and those that’ll be there for your highest. A lot of the ex members taught me those of which that lack confidence, maturity, dedication, honesty, love, perseverance,  will always leave you. They will never support you but they will always hold on regret and intuition will always allow them to know they are wrong. It may not seem like a lot to lie to some stranger from the internet but in actuality I’m some stranger that actually gives a fuck about everyone in all. Storm Szn is in full affect. See you soon💕

text:
Where are my friends from Mexico-Salvador?  I want to dedicate this post to all of them, I know some of them, some more Mexicans and others more Salvadorans but in the end we are all brothers, there are many Salvadorans who hate Mexicans and many Mexicans who hate Salvadorans and I think that is stupid,  It's like hating your stepbrother 🤦‍♂️ so if you're one of them don't waste your time in stupid things and better worry about being a better human and helping others without discrimination!
Donde  estan mis amigos mexico-salvadoreños?!! quiero dedicar este post a todos ellos, conozco a algunos de ellos, algunos mas mexicanos y otros mas salvadoreños pero al final todos somos hermanos, existen muchos salvadoreños que odian a los mexicanos y muchos mexicanos que odian salvadoreños y yo pienso que eso es estupido, es como odiar a tu hermanastro 🤦‍♂️ asi que si eres uno de ellos no pierdas tu tiempo en estupideces y mejor preocupate por ser un mejor humano y ayudar al projimo sin descrimonacion!!
#unasolatribu #unasolafamilia #mexico #elsalvador #mexicano #salvadoreño #wearehuman #weareequal #love #lovelife #loveyourfamily #loveyourself #fuckracism #fuckdescrimination #fuckabuse #fuckthesistem #todossomoshermanos #todossomosfamilia

text:
To the pieces of @&#*^@#% little high school boys that are talking shit about my daughter behind her back....
Let's be clear that she has earned her spot on the Royals! She has 4 years, 5 seasons, 2 championship games and a championship ring to prove her place. The blue Jersey that she wore proudly today at school was not her boyfriend's, ITS HERS! She actually doesn't have time to date you pathetic immature knobs... because she's so busy earning her spot. 
She has been the only girl on her teams for years, which as any other woman knows that means she's busy breaking a glass ceiling. When you are sleeping in, she's up training, when you go home after school football team practice, she goes to coach another football team. *** Understand this, Sophia has to worked at least 3 times harder than you do, while you question her being on a team because she is female, and dealing with inappropriate comments... and sadly more, so if you feel the need to question if she should be on the team because she is a Girl feel free to message me so we can have a real discussion about if you've earned your place on the team.
🤦‍♀️
To @sophia__rose66 don't you ever give up, and don't let their words touch you. If anything they are afraid to be shown up by you. I and many others are so proud of you. You are amazing and you are doing amazing things!

#teachthemyoung #makeourgirlsstrong #weareequal #anythingyoucandowecando #teachyoursons #football

Keep your head up, keep smiling and most importantly keep fighting for your dreams to become reality. You’ve already accomplished way more than these punks ever will in their entire lifetime. The more @#!? they talk the more worthless they show the world they are.|Rock it girl 🙌|What a kick ass kid!|It’s sad to hear that females at her age are still having to fight so hard when they have clearly earned their place to be wherever the hell they want to be. Keep doing what you are doing Sophia and they will see how great you are. And if they don’t, well, too bad for them because they will probably grow up to be the kind of chauvinist jerks that no one likes. So proud of you for staying with the game! Girl power 💯|If you would like to point me in their direction, I would be happy to have a little chat with them.....my girls tell me I can be a little scary when I go into mamma bear mode.😉 Seriously though, boys are the worst when trying to figure out strong girls. text:
It is so incredible to see so many people owning their power and becoming teachers, healers and role models for others In these times of change. However, one has to be very careful not to allow the negative ego to intrude by putting themselves above everyone else just because they have a degree or certification. ✨✨✨✨✨✨✨✨✨✨✨✨✨✨
We are all teachers AND students. We are here to experience, learn, grow & evolve. Our encounters with others are instrumental in this process and we must always be open to seeing our mirror reflection in those we encounter, allowing others to always teach us something new about ourselves. Every single person on this planet has a special wisdom & uniqueness to offer the world. Be careful not to be led by the egos lure. We are all in this together. We are all equal...here to learn and here to teach in our human experience. 🙏

text:
Unglaublich, dass es mich fast Überwindung kostet, mich selbst als Feministin zu bezeichnen. Feminismus ist in meinem Kopf noch immer wahnsinnig negativ besetzt. Mir kommt da gleich Alice Schwarzer in den Sinn, deren mediales Image in den 90er und 00er Jahren meinem Teenager-Ich den Begriff des Feminismus offenbar gründlich verhagelt hat. Ungeschminkte „Öko-Tanten“, die keinen BH tragen und Männer als absolutes Feindbild haben. Oder Aktivistinnen, die barbusig und lauthals Parolen schreiend von Polizisten abgeführt werden.

Dabei genieße ich alle Vorteile, die die Welt dem Feminismus zu verdanken hat! Allein die Tatsache, dass ich diesen Text posten kann, ohne meinen Mann um Erlaubnis bitten zu müssen, ist für mich ganz und gar selbstverständlich. Für so viele andere Frauen ist das aber noch immer nicht denkbar! Und auch ich selbst stoße fast täglich auf Ungerechtigkeiten gegenüber Frauen, die mich fuchsteufelswild machen!

So kann es nicht weitergehen. Jedenfalls nicht für mich. Nicht mit mir. Noch habe ich keinen Plan wohin mich diese Gedanken führen werden. Mal sehen.

Bist du ein/e Feminist/in?
comments: |#feminist #ichdarfdas #girlpower💪 #feministmovement #feminist #feminista #icandothattoo #feminists #feministas #girlpower #weareequal|Bin ich. Die Negativbetonung des Wortes ist leider vorallem durch strukturellen Sexismus bedingt. Fast durch die Bank wurden Frauen, die für ihre Rechte einstanden als „hysterische Alte“ dargestellt und Männer, die sie darin unterstützten als „verkappte Schwuchteln“. Es hat sich gebessert, aber noch bei weitem nicht im ausreichenden Maß, nicht einmal hierzulande.

text:
We are more than your trend. We are more than your marketing concept. We are more than the face of your campaign. We are more than your video vixens. We are not your punching bags. We are not your enemy. We are not your doormats. We are not your dumping grounds. ⠀
We are your MOTHER. Your SISTER. Your GRANDMOTHER. Your AUNTS. We are HUMAN BEINGS. We are PEOPLE. We are THE PEOPLE. We are QUEENS. We are the sun, moon, stars and the universe. We are GOD(DESSES) & deserve to be treated as such. We are tired of you realizing what you had when its gone. We are tired of the harassment, the humiliation, and the embarrassment. We are tired of being practice.
⠀
When was the last time you gave a black woman flowers, literally and figuratively?⠀
⠀
TAG A BLACK WOMAN YOU APPRECIATE. 🌹 ⠀

text:
Today is a Great Day! It is also a great time to sit with yourself and make a promise to never neglect your internal self. When you begin to listen to the confusion or pain within you, that’s when you take control of your LIFE.

It’s easy to go through Life accepting the uncomfortable emotions we tend to hold inside. Then defending the process of self sacrificing for others and need of being accepted. I’m fine, it’s ok ... when it’s Not!
The truth is that we neglect the one person that has coped with so much all your life. Has been loyal and supportive at every stage, never abandoned you and yet we easily ignore their distress .  We don’t listen to our internal child... who deals with the BS of others and the decisions based on their needs and wants.
When you value and respect that internal you, the one that is childishly honest and curious for all that LIFE has to offer - you will be stronger and happier. 
Then you are the Best for every person because you will show them what it looks like to be Responsible for the future.  Loving yourself starts by loving the ‘mini you 💫’ #loveyou #minime #lovingmeunconditionally #notnegotiable #lifeblueprintmyway #divalife #honesty #truth #responsibility #wetoo #theheartofhope #womeninbusiness #teamdivas #balidivaretreat #breatheinlove #nomore #weareequal #inspiration #womenofpower #childrenfirst #lifecoach

text: Look how big these little angels are getting🥰 Vida and Sasha are thriving and loving life, and are enjoying all the snuggles. We saved these two sisters while bearing witness last month at a livestock auction where they were being sold for sacrifice. Whenever I tell people that story, they look at me like I’m crazy! What?! People don’t sacrifice animals anymore! Oh yes. Yes they do. In the end it’s really no difference then slaughtering animals for consumption... a living being that doesn’t want to die.. is murdered against their will. Next time you see a rack of lamb or leg of lamb.. this is your lamb. Vida and Sasha. And they want to live. They all want to live and most aren’t as lucky as these beautiful girls. Vida. To live. Sasha. To protect. For the animals. Always. #savedfromslaughter #theirlivesmatter #weareequal #noonewantstodie #ifightforthem #4themiwill #veganaf #animalrights #sharetheirstories #nonprofitforanimals #nonprofit #animalsanctuary
comments: |Thank you for saving them!! Their story is so important to tell!|Beautiful. 😍😍|Makes this day special to know your work - and that of your fellow animal rescue warriors- has such significant results. Two beauties!|Angels|😍😍😍😍|❤️❤️❤️❤️|🙏🙏🙏❤️❤️❤️

text:
NS is a learner from the @nesbittcentre who works part-time at a recruitment firm. When he isn’t busy swimming at @lrc_hk or learning new skills at the @nesbittcentre, NS is working hard as a data encoder!

All thanks to our friends at Command Recruitment for #engaging with us and for #enriching NS’s #WorkExperience! 
Let us know in the comments below if you  agree that individuals with #specialneeds should be #empowered to #work!

#TheNesbittCentre #TNC #TNCEngageEnrichEmpower #WorkExperienceWednesday

text: Of je nu rijk, arm of gewoon minder te besteden hebt...That don’t impress me much! (Zong @shaniatwain ooit) 😌 Mensen kunnen echt zo rot doen naar elkaar. Vreselijk gewoon 😲...Maar tegenwoordig ben je ook niet helemaal meer zeker van je veiligheid als je intervenieert in een situatie waarin jij de hulpeloosheid en belediging voelt van iemand 😔 Durf jij er wat van te zeggen als je ziet dat iemand geschoffeerd wordt? Ik zeg eerlijk dat ik het steeds moeilijker vind worden. Tijden zijn gewoon veranderd. Tag je vrienden die dit moeten lezen 🙏🏻

Do you hear those screams?⁣⁣

Good. ⁣⁣

Let them haunt your dreams. Let them permeate your senses. Every time you reach out for the #4 value meal or consider that extra order of boneless wings, let those screams fill your psyche and let them never leave. ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
A vote against veganism is a vote for screaming animals thrown into slaughterhouses. Your call. ⁣⁣
⁣
We’re heading into a slaughterhouse tomorrow night. I’ll watch my favorite animals be killed and chopped up into pieces.⁣
⁣⁣
#wakethefuckup ⁣

text:
#equality ♥Today, spontaneously, I joined the Equality March walking down the streets of Katowice for a moment. I was attracted to smiles, happy songs, positive people, and quite sad thoughts. Colorful flags fluttered above their heads, elderly people were on the march, there were children on their parents shoulders, there were dogs, there were mothers with teenage daughters and sons,  grandparents who hold hands, fathers who supporting their children in discovering who there are, heterosexual couples who showing support and the police who took care of the marchers' safety. In my country, one of the equality parades taking place in the summer ended in a massacre - firecrackers were thrown at people, beaten their people, humiliated, threatened with death, spit on them, eggs and glass thrown at them and much more physical harm was done to them. Nobody received any help, on the Internet were congratulated on having beaten an innocent person, and people from the equality parade were prosecuted and harmed. "Man and woman - a normal family" that's such slogans guided are by people with homophobic inclinations, who enjoy beating or humiliating another person because she is  herself or him is himself, and that's all. PLEASE STOP! I joined the march today because a thought appeared in my head - yes, I'm afraid of muscular people shouting their vulgar slogans of extreme homophobic nationalists, but if something is to happen to me only by the fact that I love who I love, it's okay cause it is a sign I don't have a problem. I'm not interested in strangers with their a private life and if I was to be hurt for smiling and singing among cheerful people of all ages, I'm ready for sacrifice. I'm proud of continuous work on myself and specialist doctors made me aware that my orientation isn't a disease or a problem, so I believe them and not aggressive men and women with a strange worldview❗
#katowice #marszrownosci #paradarownosci #marszrówności #paradarówności #photo #happinessintheair #imbiandproud #lgbtqcommunity #imbisexualandproud #pride  #katowice2019 #prideandproud #wewantfreedom #pride🌈 #weallthesame #justhumans #onlypeaople #morelove #weareequal #loveislove #pics #lgbt

text:
Authenticy. I come from a place where honesty, authenticity and realness was welcomed.  I got a message from a close friend this past week, who just knows me SO well. My own anxieties have come forward as my head is piling up with the do's of the year ahead, the appointments, the schedules ... and before a lot of it begins, I'm exhausted. Speech therapy, feeding specialist, occupational therapy, EEG's, genetic testing. My mind is filling up and I go to release some energy and then this happens.  I'm at the park the other day, where I could tell a social conflict might happen as a younger child approached Wes while he is in his own world <3 I kindly explained that Wes' doesn't talk much to the Dad (and then sat like the helicopter parent I feel I NEED to be) to which he shared his brother didn't either and it was just laziness and once his mom decided she wouldn't take it any longer he snapped out of it ... I HELD MY TONGUE... I get things like this a lot from people.  Another favourite is "well, he will talk one day, it's no big deal" etc.  I feel the need to defend him by sharing ALL of his struggles, as if not being able to communicate isn't hard enough. I am always observing when I'm around friends, I see how much they direct, teach, guide with just their words. Take that part of your relationship away.  THIS TOPIC HAS BEEN A TRIGGER FOR ME FOR SO LONG & usually ends in tears.  So when you're out and about please be kind.  We are all walking a different path and there is nothing more discouraging than to have someone minimize your story. 
Westley has A LOT of amazing qualities, his difficulties don't define him, and they don't define me as a parent.  Westley can spell, he knows all his colours, numbers, can count back and forth and has amazing balancing skills.  Comparison is the thief of joy ✌️
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
#childdevelopment #childdevelopmentspecialist @cv.cda #loveyourkids #redefineperfection #specialneeds #letthembelittle #weareequal #myson #myfamily #speechdelay #speechdelaytheraphy #smartkid .
.
📷 @karinuliving
comments: |❤️💕|❤️|I have been here my friend, you are not alone. Stay strong 🤗|So sorry. Thinking of you. 💕|Kindness is everything 💐|❤️|I had no idea you were going through such a difficult time.  I will be praying for you and your family.  I will do my best to always be kind.|That picture is beautiful and so is that beautiful boy. I know from my interactions with you all that you are raising your children with love, and that is what matters most.|💞 You are doing amazing with Westley, thank you for showing us a bit of what you go through and how it effects you. 💞|I understand completely how frustrating it can be to minimize the difficulty our child have, and not allowing them to define our kids.  Even with Sam as an adult, on her own, she still struggles and I still get “she is just lazy” it’s hard since I don’t even live in the same country, but she will find her own way.  I had to learn how to pray through it and allow God to lead.  Please know I am praying for your family @jacklynszabo ❤️ and Wes will do amazing things with love and support from you guys!|He is a HAM!!

Obwohl ich im Einzelhandel arbeite, habe ich in den vergangenen Jahren fast ausschließlich online eingekauft.

Kurz bei Amazon, Zalando und co. getippt, gescrollt, geklickt und „zack“ ist wenige Zeit später das Paket bei dir zu Hause.
Dann habe ich mir nur die eine Frage gestellt: „Behalten oder zurückschicken?“ 🤷🏽‍♀️ Erst in den letzten Monaten ist mir bewusst geworden, was das bedeutet.

Nun stelle ich mir lieber folgende Fragen:

Wo wird produziert?
Zu welchen Bedingungen?
Müssen Menschen wegen meinem Konsum leiden? 
Welchen Einfluss hat mein Konsum auf die Umwelt?

Und...
„Brauche ich DAS?“ 🤔

Wenn ich mir was gutes tun will, ist es dann der Kauf von materiellen Dingen?

Was macht mich wirklich glücklich?
.
.
.

text:
Look at this beautiful boy 🥰 Ruckus the sheep is indeed a mommas boy! My work week is coming to a close and I am ready to be home with the babes! Sometimes being in the service industry.. like any job.. is challenging. But it makes me soo appreciative for the life I get to live and the souls I get to share it with when I get home! I will literally pull up the driveway and starting hugging every baby I see! And they all neigh, nicker, baaa, squeal, bark, meow.. you name it.. when they hear my truck. It takes any negative that may have happened at work.. and makes it disappear. What is everyone’s favorite part of their day? Do you guys have family members(fur or human) that brighten your day??
If you missed it! Our first visitor day will be September 28th from 1-4pm! If you would like to join us for this intimate gathering.. and meet the animals and humans of HHHH, please dm me 🥰 You all rock and make my day better every day! I read through all the comments when I get in bed at night and it puts a smile on my face when I fall asleep ❤️ #happyhearthappyhome #ruckus #ruckusthesheep #animalsanctuary #furfamily #theymakemyday #mypurposeinlife #farmanimalsanctuary #animalsarebetterthanpeople #weareequal #veganforlife
comments: |My kitties greet me at the door,  every time.  They're the best|My cat just comes running to me every time I get home! Usually by the time I give her some food she doesn’t love me anymore😂 but I love her 💜|My cat just comes running to me every time I get home! Usually by the time I give her some food she doesn’t love me anymore😂 but I love her 💜|My cat just comes running to me every time I get home! Usually by the time I give her some food she doesn’t love me anymore😂 but I love her 💜|💛💛💛💛💛💛💛|He's beautiful 😍 as soon as i get home all my sheep come running to the gate 😍💕 sometimes they're more excited to see me than the dogs are 😂 my neighbours say they always know when i get home because there's suddenly a massive chorus of sheep/goats baa-ing and  my 2 jersey cows belowing and you see them all come running across the paddocks 😂😍|Hes a beauty just like his mama!! 😍 there's nothing like being greeted by your babies with so much excitement when you get home! My conure, ChiChi will fly over to me and say hi baby I love you for a good 5-10 min like he missed me so much!!😂🤗💗💗

text: “Feminism seeks to address social and gender inequality, and ultimately a more equal world is better for everyone.”Jen Thorpe. (Feminist writer and researcher. Commissioner for Gender Equality.) Yoohoo✨ I’m so honored and excited that one of my pieces has been chosen to be included in this incredible collection that will be brimming with essays,memoirs and poetry pieces on the idea of Living While Feminist. Publishing by Kwela in 2020 and editing by Jen Thorpe. text:
"Setting boundaries doesn't make me mean." I can set limits and expectations for my life and still be "Nice".
Considering your wishes doesn't mean I have to do, what you think I should do.
My feeling and thoughts are part of my decision. 
And if you don't like it, that belongs to you. "Forgive, but guard your heart until you see a sustainable change".

text:
È passato un anno da quando ad agosto 2018 è morta Dalila, lei sapeva benissimo a cosa sarebbe andata incontro e ha deciso di farla finita appena ha potuto: dopo solo quatto ore dal suo ingresso in carcere.

Il procedimento per il cambio dei documenti è ancora lunghissimo e difficoltoso per le persone transessuali e Dalila, aveva ancora il vecchio documento e per legge è stata inserita in un carcere maschile.

Anche voi pensate sia assurdo e ingiusto ? .
.
[Fonte bitchyf]

#weareequal #transgender
#lgbttrans #transgirl #mtf #mtftransition #transrights

text:
Sabato è successa una cosa meravigliosa! Il mondo ha bisogno di notizie così, soprattutto la ns Italia!
Sarà un caso proprio che una FAMIGLIA ARCOBALENO abbia dato vita a un gesto di uguaglianza e solidarietà vs il diverso? Io non credo!
Io preferisco condividerlo oggi che stanno iniziando a parlarne meno perché è una carezza al cuore che non va dimenticata ♥️
.
Grande merito a Desirè Nica <3
.
.
===
L Italia quella bella, oggi ve la racconto io da Trapani
.

Sono le 13.00, e arriva sulla spiaggia uno dei tanti ambulanti che cercano di vendere qualcosa.
Solo che stavolta è donna
.
Solo che stavolta è mamma
.

Ha una cesta enorme che tiene in bilico sulla testa, con dentro tutto ciò che vorrebbe vendere, e dietro, legata sulla fascia, la sua bambina.
Avrà 2 anni e mezzo, 3 al massimo. Sta sotto al sole in groppa alla sua mamma mi chiedo da chissà quante ore
.

Subito mi sento in difficoltà
.
Guardo mia figlia e penso che sono 3 ore che mi affanno per farle scegliere cosa mangiare, per coprirle la testa dal sole, per stare attenta che non beva acqua troppo fredda.

Dico a Gabri che vado a comprare qualcosa da quella mamma e che vado a portare un po' di frutta fresca alla bimba e darle qualcosa da mangiare
.

Ma non c'è stato bisogno di fare niente
.

Perché oggi l'Italia bella è stata quella delle mie vicine di ombrellone che tutte insieme hanno detto a quella mamma come loro, di andare a lavorare tranquilla, perché alla sua bambina ci avrebbero pensato loro
.

Ed è proprio così che è andata
.
La mamma ha continuato il suo giro per le spiagge, e la piccola ha mangiato insieme a tutti i nostri figli sotto l ombra del ristorante dello stabilimento, ha giocato sulla riva, ha fatto i gavettoni insieme agli altri bambini della spiaggia
.

E io oggi sono felice, perché è stato davvero bello vedere tutto questo ❤️
=== #famigliearcobaleno #love #liberamentemamma #gestidamore #weareequal #family
comments: |Sono quei gesti che ti riempiono il cuore d'amore e che dimostrano che ancora abbiamo dei sentimenti!! Troppi pochi, ma ci sono💕💕💕|🙌🙌🙌😘😘😘👏|Grazie, mi hai fatto iniziare bene la giornata 🙏😘|Le persone quelle belle ❤️❤️❤️

text: Our (Alabama) governor Kay Ivey made an apology for a racial skit and photos she took in college 50 years ago. Now don’t get me wrong, we all do things we regret, however I take serious issue with the fact that she boasted about her “Racial Tolerance” and how she hoped to spread it throughout the state... Tolerance? So our governor just tolerates other races? I’m not so sure her feelings have changed much from the 60s with that explanation and word choice. Guys please expect better from our leaders. It’s 2019 we should be better than that. Love each other. #dobetter #loveeachother #beexcellenttoeachother #weareequal

text:
One more time more memories I could bring with me 🙌 First of all, I want to thank God for all the opportunities , for my family , and some friends that dedicated their time with me, many blessed moments, I appreciated everything ! But I cannot forget to thank all the animals that I could touch there and smell their different personalities , they aren’t different from us , they have family, love , feelings , and respect . The only thing that I ask you is to open your mind and see how beautiful they are with no judgments, we have no differences , so with compassion and small changes we can do a lot , I think this is the best way 🙌🐶🐷🐯🦁🐹🦆🐥🐝🐴🕷🦟🐜🐝🐓🐄🐈🦃
.
The love that comes from them is incredible , unconditionally , and for those who love them with an open heart , for sure can feel my thoughts! Also, I hope my country feels better after all the things  happening on Amazonia 🙌🌱 I wish that everyone has a big heart to take care of our families, friends, planet and for sure all the animals ! Real Love is the one when we give to others without expecting anything in return❤ . 
#missingbrazilalready #veganism #animalsright #strongveganwoman #environment #septemberwithoutmeat #smallchangesbigresults #weareequal

text:
You deserve the same love as everyone else.
Your worth is not defined by what you’re doing, but your being.
.

I strongly believe that if everyone lived from this conviction, we would;
.

Be more compassionate towards
ourselves and each other
.

Set healthy boundaries
.

Had better health
.

Been more creative
.

Helped each other
.

Been more positive
.

Felt more joy and inner peace
.

Created more good energy
.

Created more peace
.

Cared for our planet, the animals, each other
.

And the list goes on.
.

Every day we have a choice to think, feel and act from a place of hostility or a place of love.
.

It all starts within each one of us.
.

I choose love!❤️
.

Who's with me?
.

text:
Wie kann es sein, dass drei Leute versuchen, einen Dieb zu stellen und von geschätzt 20 Rumstehenden nur ein einziger Mann hilft, damit die Diebesbanden vielleicht mal lernen, dass sie nicht immer so davonkommen?! Und wie kann es sein, dass solche Diebe einfach wieder laufen gelassen werden, weil sie Flüchtlinge sind? Versteht mich nicht falsch, wenn jemand fliehen muss und Hilfe braucht, soll er sie haben! Überhaupt, wenn jemand Hilfe braucht. Aber das kann kein Grund sein, dass diese Leute nicht bestraft werden. Wer Mist baut, muss dafür Verantwortung übernehmen - jeder, ganz gleich, welches Alter/ Geschlecht oder welcher Herkunft oder was auch immer. ~ 
How could it happen, that three people struggle to catch a thief and there are about 20 people just enjoying the show? And just one single man comes to help? So that those gangs might learn there will be consequences! And how can it be right that the thief will be free just some time later - because he is a refugee?! Do not get me wrong. Everyone deserves to be helped if they need help either the had to flee or not. But this can’t be a reason for not being punished. If you mess up you have to show responsibility NO matter how old you are or what gender or nation or what ever!  #wasstimmthiernicht #dankedeutschland #weareequal #responsibility #deutschland #politik #fassungslos #dankebüroetage #sicheristanders #echtjetzt #frustrated

text:
I think it's funny when people ask me why my style changes from either masculine/feminine or wonder who is the dominant in my relationship. I use to get offended but I brush it off. I decided a long time ago that I would not define myself to labels and love all aspects of femininity and masculinity. I also was lucky to find a partner who feels the same and let's me be who I am and understands we are equal in every way.

text:
To the dedicated and fearless women who paved our path to the freedom that we have today. Thank you!
.
.
.
.
.
#nationalwomensequalityday #equalityday #womensequalityday #women #woman #sacrifice #freedom #equal #weareequal #thankyou #riseup #speakup #beproud #stepup #womensday #honor #honorablewomen #female #femalepower #proud #standup #believe #praise #strong #strongwomen #fight #equality

Happy Women’s Equality Day! We love this message from @britandco founded by @brit Morin. Young women need to see take-charge women in all areas of society. BE A LEADER.  Our future depends on it. (Image by Brit + Co)⁠
⁠
Why do we celebrate Women’s Equality Day on August 26th? On August 26, 1920, Amendment 19 was finalized:⁠
⁠ “The right of citizens of the United States to vote shall not be denied or abridged by the United States or by any State on account of sex. Congress shall have power to enforce this article by appropriate legislation.”⁠
⁠
This first voting rights hurdle was huge. But don’t forget that this was only extended to white women. Women of color did not get the right to vote until 1965, 45 years later. While we have made gains over the years, we have a LONG long way to go. ⁠
⁠
Hope you join us today in celebrating #womensequalityday by doing something to advance women. Whether it be advocating for a women’s group, mentoring a young woman, or simply being vocal where you see inequality, every little bit helps. While it may be cliche, “Individually, we are one drop. Together, we are an ocean.”⁠
⁠
Need suggestions? We are loving the message over at @equalitycantwait started by @melindafrenchgates  See some ways to take action at https://equalitycantwait.evoke.org/action⁠
⁠
This is not a sponsored post, just real admiration for those passionately advocating for the advancement of women. ⁠

text:
today is #nationalwomensequalityday 
on this day, in 1920, women were finally granted the right to vote. .
Lucretia Mott, Elizabeth Staton, Martha Wright, Mary Ann McClintock and Jane Hunt are to thank for setting this fight in motion. they began the battle for the right to have a voice in 1848, and 171 years later we are not only able to vote, but run for office as well. .
women’s equality has come so far, and there is still a fight to fight. i’m still not able to walk alone at night without fearing for my safety, i carry a small knife on my key ring because i feel i have to and my voice still gets lost amongst the voice of men. .
let’s continue to fight for true equality. not women above men, or men above women, but equals. fair rights for both and equal opportunities. .
.
.

text:
I am a proud vegan and understand that all animals and humans are equal. 150 million animals are being killed every day for our selfish race! You wouldn’t eat your dog or cat and sheep, cows, pigs and chickens are no different! You wouldn’t drink your wife’s milk so why an animals! They all have feelings and they feel emotional & physical pain like us so why would we continue to torture & murder them when we can get all the nutrients a human could ever need from plants. It’s all a no Brainer to us and people that choose to remain brain washed are only fools to themselves. Not only are you hurting, killing and eating living things but your also killing yourself. Just look at how many people have diseases or are struggling with some mental or physical health disorder. Meat, dairy and eggs are the root cause ! But if you used some common sense you would see why, your eating dead rotting corpses!! Or milk that’s meant for a baby cow! Or it wasn’t actually it was drugs making the cow produce the milk! (Torture) Wake up people it’s time to think outside of the box ☝️

text: Growing up, I assumed life would be easier if I pretended I was the same as everyone else around me. I didn’t want to focus on the things that made me different — on my appearance or the surgeries I had to have. Instead, I compartmentalized my experiences. I tried to convince myself I was the same as everyone else, because maybe if I forced myself to believe it, everyone else would too. But I’ve spent the last few years coming to terms with my differences. And for some, it may be annoying that I talk about my appearance and my facial difference so much. But for me, it’s the most liberating thing in the world. To be able to say “this is me. Take it or leave it,” and go to sleep each night okay with who I am feels like a miracle. I spent so many years drowning in the weight of who I was (more about that in my book). Living unapologetically is freeing. And I’m only at this point now from writing and sharing my story — from connecting with others who have had similar experiences to mine. All of this is to say that there is so much beauty in living authentically, in being different. Whoever you are and whatever your story is, be you. Shine your light. Speak your truth. Let your freak flag fly. Because even if you don’t believe it now, there’s a whole community of people out there waiting to love you.

I walk around stores/restaurants/amusement parks like a human shield when I catch kids, adults staring or pointing  and I very subtley shift my position to block them from her sight so she won't see them.  To me she is normal, she is my normal❤️ but to others, she is not.  I feel like I fail her everyday.  When stranger in Target says "what's wrong with her?" I smile and say "nothing" ever so politely. My daughter is 13 and jr high can be a little rough so I can't wait to read your book!!! I love you posts, you have no idea how much they help me. text:
My Opinion On The Gacha Vs Artists Drama
.
I have been talking about this alot but here ya guys go. .
.
If you have a different opinion that wont offend anybody then please put it in the comments. Please dont be rude in the comments. I want the comment section to be a friendly open place. If the comments turn into rude snarky comments then I will disable them. .
.
Please be nice to one another.
.
.
Tags below.
.
.
.
#gacha #gachahate #gachahaterssuck #gachahater #gachahaters #gachavsartist #gachaeditsarehard #gachaeditsareactuallyartbutwhatever #gachaeditsareart #stopthehate #gacharights #gachaartist #myopinion #pleasestopthehate #weareequal #lovegacha #gachaeditorsareartiststoo
.
@lonely.cloud._ , please listen. Nobody is perfect, but please just know that you shouldn't let your jealousy and selfishness take you over. It's not okay.
comments: |oop hi|Ok this comment has nothing to do w the post but more about your bio, you spelled "friendly" wrong. I didnt want to dm you because i feel this isnt a big problem just wanted to let you know ❤️|You have earned 1+ follower! ^^ 🌱💞🐌💞🌱|I’ve heard that editors don’t have permission to take commissions as it’s actually not theirs and kinda making money off a creator. But Gacha players are allowed to edit not commission! Correct me if I’m wrong! :)|Haha sorry girl but Im not that type of artist... :/|Yeaaaaaaas I'm 100% agree with you!|I really recently just started getting into the gacha community buuut my friends dislike it (I'm not saying hate because some of the stuff, they like about it) yeah they're all artists but it's not because of the "tracing" and honestly all that crap is annoying how people think using bases is "tracing" artists uses bases! And also the part about artists hating the gacha community for getting more attention.. that's all complete bs first of all I kinda see why, the gacha community isn't just art but you can create stories and glmv's etc. etc. There are many more subjects to choose someone may not like the art but like your stories and vice versa... I’m not just talking about the artists either (I mean I’m an artist myself and i haven’t abandoned the art community just to join the gacha community but thats another topic-) some gacha users really DIDNT try when making stories and stuff... but when making art even if its a simple style you can see the hard work and time it took.. instulting a gacha editor its like insulting an artist.. i know editing isn’t the same thing though its still art as you proved in the post everyone has they’re own opinion but if you’re being rude no ones gonna wanna listen to you (sorry for the long text- and also im agreeing with you 😅)|Honestly I find this thing so stupid I have a friend who does edits and they are amazing they take so long to do. So people stop saying it isn’t art because it is.  artists are suppose to RESPECT EACHOTHER AND TO NOT GIVE HATE TO OTHER ARTISTS SO GET OVER IT|Why is this feud even a thing? Why can’t everyone just do their own thing and get along?|Mmmm cool. ❤️|I agree with you.....except for the tracing and “GACHA CREATORS DONT PUT EFFORT” Part. People trace over the “base” for their edits in order for it to be a “gacha edit” so yes,it is a form of tracing. For the “gacha creators don’t put effort” part we mean the mini stories,”singing battles”, and the GMV and how they are just screenshots made in KineMaster. An animator can do an animation meme that has beautiful art and editing and animation and get like half of the attention and exposure then a person that took screenshots and put copyrighted music in. Although that might sound like animatics the difference between animatics and gacha mini movies etc. is that with animatics you are drawing contrast to gacha where you use the same bases and such. BUT (yes there is a but to this) if they are as good as the ones you showed then that wouldn’t be considered overrated, in fact those posts deserve the attention they get.

text:
UPDATE!! So maybe 2 weeks or so ago I made a post where I found a rogue flower blooming through the cracks of packed ground and stone despite the challenge 🌺. I also found it crushed the next day... (8 posts ago, it’s a pic of a white flower, def check out the story behind it). I have recently noticed that the flower is trying to make a comeback!!! It’s beginning to grow some green leaves and sprout once more 🌱  I’m excited 🤗  I have tried to establish a barrier with rocks as a physical fence around it. Might add to it to help people notice it. I want to take special care of it this time. For some reason that flower really spoke to me and I neglected to pay attention the first time, but it looks like I get another chance.
We don’t all get second chances when we neglect something to the point it is then taken from us. Be mindful of what is truly important. It’s all about the little miracles ✨🌷
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.

text:
they say they seem to be perfect enough to continue to judge. we should try to be together in the situation they are in, then we can look at all the angles. when they are in a negative environment, we should bring them out in a positive direction.
talking and judging is easier than exploring and understanding the situation. each position has different angles and not everything will work out the way we expect it to.
they are already stressed enough in their efforts to improve their steps and strengthen their role. not only do they have to face great opposition but they also face an uncomfortable situation.
if you cannot accept failure or lack of trust, simply dismiss the complaint. do not let it go to your heart, and at the same time judge it to be a bad judgment and to create a gap between you.
stop right away, we are the same .. just different places and ways. but judging one another is not our nature.

text:
Yes, more of these voices please. We should never forget we are equal, we are one. .
Posted @withrepost • @helprefugeesuk Pia Klemp, the German ship captain who rescued migrants in the Mediterranean, as she refuses a medal from the mayor of Paris: "I'm not a humanitarian. I am not there to 'aid'. I stand in solidarity. We do not need medals. We do not need authorities deciding about who is a 'hero' and who is 'illegal'. In fact they are in no position to make this call, because we are all equal.
"What we need are freedom and rights. It is time we call out hypocrite honoring and fill the void with social justice. It is time we cast all medals into spearheads of revolution!
"Documents and housing for all!
"Freedom of movement and residence!"'
- Pia Klemp, 20 August 2019

text:
I introduced you to Marialuisa from @migaswimwear yesterday. Now today, I want you to introduce you to the third member of our proposed @SXSW panel on Disfigurement as Identity. Meet Nathalia, the motivational speaker and self love advocate behind @lovingmydots ! Nathalia was born with #nevus — a non-genetic birthmark that covered 40% of her face in addition to the moles, or satellites, all over her body. From the time she was 9 months old until the age of 13, Nathalia had many surgeries to remove her facial Nevus. And in 2018, Nathalia started sharing her story on social media as a body positive advocate. She now gives motivational speeches to help others build self-esteem too! I’m so grateful to have connected with Nathalia and hope to attend #SXSW with her and Marialuisa next year. The three of us are so passionate about #disfigurement and #visibledifference . I know I’ve been talking about SXSW quite a bit lately, but there is only ONE MORE DAY left to vote for panels. So please help us bring our stories and message to a larger audience by visiting the link in my bio and voting for us. text:
❌What it means to look different??❌
.
We live in a world that we are what you look like. Whether you have visible differences or not, you are constantly judged by your appearance and that has to change!🚫
.
That is why we want to bring this subject to #SXSW with our panel! Tomorrow is the last day to VOTE! Please VOTE UP for us - Link in BIO! 🗳
.
Meet @arielhenley who I will have the pleasure (hopefully) to be on the panel with along @migaswimwear at South by Southwest.💛
.
Ariel Henley is a writer with Crouzon syndrome. After dozens of surgeries that altered the appearance of her face, she grew up in a world that insisted on defining her by a face she didn’t even recognize. As an identical twin, Ariel grew up not only experiencing the impact of this treatment firsthand but witnessing it as well.
.
She’s written articles about disfigurement and facial difference for outlets like The New York Times and Teen Vogue. She is also the author of A FACE FOR PICASSO, a forthcoming memoir about her experience with disfigurement, which will be published in winter 2021. By telling her story, she hopes to help eliminate stigma, educate others about the importance of facial equality, and promote mainstream inclusion for individuals with physical differences.
.
.
.
#sxsw2020 #sxswpanelpicker equality #bekind #choosekind #bodyimagemovement #makethechange #thursdaythoughts #lovedisfigure #crouzonsyndrome #nevus #visibledifference #faceequality #behindthescars #scarstrong #motivationalspeaker #inspirational #weareequal #bodypositive #ihaveembraced #bethechange

PLEASE READ AND TAKE NOTICE.

Last night Paul Pogba witnessed Racial Abuse throughout the whole match. This is absolutely disgraceful to see that this kind of hatred is still around in the world of football, not just inthe world of football but in life in general. And how many times that these low lifes have to hear no matter what the colour, religion, or nationality, we are all the same. I hope these sick people realise how much damage they are causing to families. We should give them as  what i call a taste of their own medicine. They have to realise and come to conclusion that the world has changed, they need to learn that equality is a thing not a word. Some people say that "oh we have to move on be strong", but what they're basically doing is that they are letting these trouble makers who think this is entertainment to take over us , and make us all enemies. We stand with Pogba.

text:
Real men ARE feminists. Why shouldn't they want equality? The stigma that feminism only helps women is utter crap. Men need equality too. We all want equality. The idea of equality and feminism is so simple. 'Genders being treated equally'. Yet this message isn't being translated. People think that Feminist isn't a good word. But it is. People think men can't be feminists. But they can. I have a good friend who agrees that women should be equal to men but doesn't want to be a feminist because feminists are extremists. When they aren't. These all annoy me so much but the core anger behind each refusal to feminism is stereotypes. So all you other feminist accounts are doing such an amazing job. Carry on!
.
.
Via @feminist.aus .
.
.#feminism #feminist #equalrights #equality #equalityact #weareequal #same #empoweringwomen #empoweringmen #futureisfemale #fuckstereotypes #fuckhomophobia #loveislove

text:
Listen, dear... Everyone has the same amount of time during the day. Each of us handles it in their own way. The way I manage my time let me travel the world and reduce the stress. The way others do it let them have happy families or win the championships. And I accept that.
.
The way I decided to spend my freetime,
as well as the way I express myself are different than yours and may be different from your expectations. It doesn’t make me a stupid person. 😉 We just have different lifes.
.
The fact I denied meeting you doesn’t make me a stupid person. I know 4 languages, I have been to 34 countries, in 5 I lived. I saw a lot in my life. My EQ is well developed.
.
We have different roles, different priorities, different circumstances. Maybe you met me 2 years ago but I am a different person now.  I’ve grown and moved on. 
There is still so much to see in this world! Who has time for dramaqueens?😉 .
Explore the world and be kind to each others. You will see more. Peace! ✌🏼#lovefirst #bekind #nodrama #truth💯 #weareequal #respectyourself

This is the story of pride ! 
WAIT ! where are you running ? 
Because now there's no place to hide.
Dear society, recognised us ? 
Yes ! We are PRIDE 💞 
Earlier we believed, that history owes an apology to us for letting you all mistreat us from the start. We were down there, under your feet ; Struggling yet United ✊Life has been a beautiful struggle. It still is. Why ? Let us tell you a fun fact ! 
You know what even harder than waiting for a bill to pass ? Changing This Societal Perception. Life, Healing, Sunlight, Nature, Harmony and Spirit is what we are made of...colourful just like our flag and just like any other human we deserve Love, Kindness, Acceptance and Respect because we are no less... WE ARE EQUAL 🤝✊
.
.
.
Picture and caption credits -  @yashasvi.bhati

Compassion becomes real when we recognize our shared humanity. It binds us together. We want to turn our suffering into hope for the future. A different approach we have turned to is sharing the stories of other humans and releasing the stigma attached homelessness and to their "reputation". The more we share and connect the more we can see the change happen in our lifetime. ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀

text:
“Beauty is not in the face; beauty is a light in the heart.”
- Kahlil Gibran.
.
Saw this in the loo at a restaurant the other week. They have this message instead of a mirror.
.
Thank you @labaraccabali - you made me stop and reflect.
.
If I was 100% happy and at peace with myself... Would I need to stop and check that my hair is okay?
.
No.
.
(Maybe this is why many great spiritual masters shave their heads? 😂... @radhanathswami @srila_prabhupad)
.
A nice reminder that I’m already enough.
.
A nice reminder that we are all, already enough.
.
A nice reminder to try and see the beauty in everyone I meet.
.
And, a nice reminder to try and treat everyone equally.
.
It’s easy to forget that behind this material illusion, we are all the same.
.
We are all lost, divine souls, trying to find our way.
.
Love
.
#wakeupneo #youarebeautiful #lostsouls #weareequal #harekrishna #maya #love #radanathswami

text: Every night before bed Ruckus comes up to me for pets and snuggles. When we rescued Ruckus and Bella, we also saved Ruckus’s sister Stormi, who passed away from pneumonia. The night she passed away my heart hurt more then anything for Ruckus, cause he knew his sister was gone. I stayed up all night with him and my mom came to sit with him the next day. I’ll never forget him nuzzling her body, wanting her so badly to get up. I still get choked up thinking about it. But in return I got the most beautiful relationship with Ruckus and Bella and that I am so forever grateful. Animals are just like us, only different. They know their families, their friends.. they know when one another is sick or in pain.. one day the world will see us all as equals ❤️ #animalrights #weareequal #thesameonlydifferent #ruckus #hecausesaruckus #hairsheep #happytails #mychildren #workingtomaketheworldabetterplace #familybonds #animalbonds #veganactivism #veganactivists #animalsanctuary #happytails #momlove

text:
Trying to get a picture of both of them is a game in a half lol. What funny boys these two are. They are such huge pieces of my heart and soul. Has anyone else had trouble this summer with the 100 year storms that keep hitting? I have lost more grass and seed this year due to flooding, amongst other things that we have resorted to feeding more hay then an average summer. It cost us about $175 a week for hay right now and winter it doubles! Due to last weeks storm, a portion of our driveway got washed away, and needs to be fixed this week before any more water damage can occur to our property and surrounding houses. This is an added expense we were not planning for, and if we could raise the money to cover this weeks hay bill, it would be a huge weight lifted ❤️ A hay bale is $6, and we need 30! Every $1 adds up and means the world to all of us here at the Happy Home! Fingers crossed tomorrow’s storm is nothing like it has been 🤞🤞🤞. Thank you for believing in our journey! We couldn’t do this without you all! And remember all donations are tax deductible!! VENMO: HHHHFR24
PayPal: https://www.paypal.me/Laurenrosborough #sanctuarylove #cowappreciation #steer #moocow #vegansforanimals #hay #hayday #nomorestorms #fundraiser #taxwriteoff #nonprofit #animalsmakemehappy #heartandsoul #cownoses #hamilton #oatmeal #farmsanctuarylife #farmanimalsanctuary #weareequal #alllivesmatter #vegansonamission #vegan #notyourmilk

text: My wise friend @sansan_8 shared this! She was one of my best friends with GG and Anneline at University when we were 20 ... she helped me get through subjects reminding me about deadlines while I maintained my daydreamer status. Somehow I did well. I adore the wisdom she shares. All the years remind me of the importance of friendship and bridges and of taking care of one another. I compete with no one! I am me and I only dislike the feeling when others don’t understand this and try to force me to shift or try to look down on me when we are equals... This is not a competition for me we are here to support each other 💕  #michaelanessimart #thingstobelievein #quoteoftheday #weareequal
comments: |Awh sweetie you’re gonna make me cry!! You have always been so special to me. You’re an angel on earth shedding light and love. I adore your spirit and flair. Your creativity and beauty. It’s been a pleasure being your friend and though we are miles apart and life has taken us separate ways you will always always always hold a special place in my heart. I love how the universe brings people together. Blessed I am. 🙏😘😍💕Thank you for being my friend 🦋 😘

text:
🕋
Pic of my son & I leaning against the Kaaba. I am hovering over him to shield him from the crowds. His head is shaven bc we had previously completed our umrah pilgrimage.
🕋
The Kaaba is a cube-shaped building in Mecca around which Muslims circumambulate as part of pilgrimage. It is covered in a specially made black cloth, called the kiswa, decorated with Arabic / Islamic calligraphy. Getting to touch the Kaaba is a particular blessing, especially one corner of it holding the black stone.
🕋
Currently millions of Muslims are gathered in Mecca for the annual Hajj pilgrimage. During this time Muslims follow the footsteps of prophets & pious predecessors, such as Abraham and his wife Hagar, by performing certain rituals.
🕋
Tomorrow, 9th of #dhulhijjah, is the greatest day of the Hajj when they will stand on the plains of Arafah and beseech their Lord with countless prayers & tears.
🕋
Muslims all over the world will also pause on this day to reflect, pray, & worship, as it is one of the holiest days of the year, even for those not in Mecca. It is an important day to fast, as it absolves the sins of 2 years, the previous & the upcoming.
🕋
That is also the day that Prophet Muhammadﷺ gave his farewell sermon, detailing critical advice for his followers. Swipe to read all of it - 2 excerpts below:
🕋
To the men: “It is true that you have certain rights with regard to your women but they also have rights over you. Remember that you have taken them as your wives only under God‘s trust and with His permission. If they abide by your right then to them belongs the right to be fed & clothed in kindness. Do you treat your women well and be kind to them for they are your partners & committed helpers.”
🕋
To all: “𝙰𝚕𝚕 𝚖𝚊𝚗𝚔𝚒𝚗𝚍 𝚒𝚜 𝚏𝚛𝚘𝚖 𝙰𝚍𝚊𝚖 𝚊𝚗𝚍 𝙴𝚟𝚎, 𝚊𝚗 𝙰𝚛𝚊𝚋 𝚑𝚊𝚜 𝚗𝚘 𝚜𝚞𝚙𝚎𝚛𝚒𝚘𝚛𝚒𝚝𝚢 𝚘𝚟𝚎𝚛 𝚊 𝚗𝚘𝚗-𝙰𝚛𝚊𝚋 𝚗𝚘𝚛 𝚊 𝚗𝚘𝚗-𝙰𝚛𝚊𝚋 𝚑𝚊𝚜 𝚊𝚗𝚢 𝚜𝚞𝚙𝚎𝚛𝚒𝚘𝚛𝚒𝚝𝚢 𝚘𝚟𝚎𝚛 𝚊𝚗 𝙰𝚛𝚊𝚋; 𝚊𝚕𝚜𝚘 𝚊 𝚠𝚑𝚒𝚝𝚎 𝚑𝚊𝚜 𝚗𝚘 𝚜𝚞𝚙𝚎𝚛𝚒𝚘𝚛𝚒𝚝𝚢 𝚘𝚟𝚎𝚛 𝚋𝚕𝚊𝚌𝚔 𝚗𝚘𝚛 𝚊 𝚋𝚕𝚊𝚌𝚔 𝚑𝚊𝚜 𝚊𝚗𝚢 𝚜𝚞𝚙𝚎𝚛𝚒𝚘𝚛𝚒𝚝𝚢 𝚘𝚟𝚎𝚛 𝚠𝚑𝚒𝚝𝚎 𝚎𝚡𝚌𝚎𝚙𝚝 𝚋𝚢 𝚙𝚒𝚎𝚝𝚢 𝚊𝚗𝚍 𝚐𝚘𝚘𝚍 𝚊𝚌𝚝𝚒𝚘𝚗.”
🕋

2 weeks ago, @noortjepalmers came to me with the idea to create a human rainbow for her new photoseries En Masse 🌈 The rainbow is not only a symbol for the LBGTQ-movement, but also for peace & equality. It’s colors are vibrant and beautiful, and each one is different than the next. With this project we wanted to send a beautiful message of inclusiveness, cohesion and equality. The result demonstrates how beautiful diversity can be and just as the rainbow, it teaches us to embrace our own differences and the differences of those around us.
.
Credits: EN MASSE pt. 1
Photography: @noortjepalmers
Styling: @farahelbastani
Casting: @sienjosephinecasting
Production: @roellambrechts
Production assistent: @leoniegvrs @capture_be
DOP: @shotbylevin
Video: @jasper.leonard
MUA: @carolienw
.
Met dank aan alle cast! Jullie waren geweldig! 💕
.
.

#WeAreIndigenous #rape #intersectionality #racewars #indigenouswomen #indigenouswomenrise #intersectionalfeminism #womensrights #marginalized #weareallhumans #weareequal #unwomen #shewillsurvive

text:
2 weeks ago, @noortjepalmers came to me with the idea to create a human rainbow. 🌈 The rainbow is not only a symbol for the LBGTQ-movement, but also a symbol for peace & equality. It’s colors are vibrant and beautiful, and each one is different than the next. With this project we wanted to send a beautiful message of inclusiveness, cohesion and equality. The result demonstrates how beautiful diversity can be and just as the rainbow, it teaches us to embrace our own differences and the differences of those around us.
.

2 years ago I decided to remove as much negativity from my life as I could. 
So I could focus on my happiness and leading a positive life. I decided it was time to invest in me !! Step one .... STOP INVESTING IN PEOPLE THAT DONT INVEST IN YOU 👊

All types of relationships should be a two way street. 
When we invest in others we give them our time and when we learn that our time is valuable we stop giving it away.

Stop asking how someones day is going when they dont first ask you.
Stop making time for people, when they dont make time for you.
Stop being present with people, who are not present with you. 
Always remember your worth !! No one is first or second in a relationship - We are only equal 🙌

P.S Follow this man @thematthewhussey and thank me later ❤👊

text:
**Please read for explanation of these videos**⁣
⁣
While traveling around Northern Thailand this past week, I had the opportunity to visit some elephant camps. I’ve been thinking a lot about how to present the information I learned and the photos/videos I took in a way that would not only point you toward more hands off ways of viewing elephants but also help to see elephant tourism/handling/care as a scale, more so than seeing it as black and white. So I’ve decided to split this story up into a couple of posts. For this post I just want to explain what “stereotypy” is in captive wildlife, because that’s a really important part of assessing psychological health and welfare. ⁣
⁣
The term stereotypy describes behaviors seen in captive wildlife that are abnormal (aka wouldn’t be seen in the wild). These behaviors often come about due to lack of stimulation (barren or inadequate environment), strict schedule of feeding or the restriction of food, inability to socialize, close contact with humans, and are used as a coping mechanism for stress. These are behaviors that an individual uses to reduce its stress; a good human example would be biting nails, fiddling with hair, pacing, tapping feet, etc.

As you can see in these videos, these two individuals show severe stereotypy. Swaying, trunk swinging, rocking, pacing, aggressive trunk flicking, these are all stereotypical behaviors that the individuals are using to cope with something that is causing stress. ⁣
⁣
Now, I know this looks bad. But just so everyone understands in full, many many many elephants show stereotypical behaviors in one way or another. Not just in camps where they are in small enclosures and being ridden, but also in sanctuaries (which is a big part of the research I’m doing). Management cannot necessarily stop these behaviors completely, but does have a major impact on frequency and severity. ⁣
⁣
.⁣
.⁣
.⁣
⁣
#elephants #elephantresearch #elephantconservation #elephantcamp #thaielephant #animalrights #treatanimalswithrespect #respectalllife #weareequal #loveallanimals #createchange #animalbehavior #wildlifeblogger #travelblogger #travelbug #research #animalresearch #conservationist #loveelephants
