text: If you’ve experienced an abusive or traumatizing relationship, you know the feelings of shame, regret, self-blame, and judgment of others. I’m not proud of it, but I used to be a person who judged women who were in abusive situations. “Why don’t they just leave?” “I’d NEVER allow a person to treat me that way.” I made assumptions about the type of woman who found herself in relationships with violent, manipulative people (weak, unintelligent, no self-worth, lesser than). It’s shameful to admit but it’s true. Now I’m one of those women, and I’ve met MANY others on this leg of the journey. And I can tell you first hand that it is SO much more complicated than that. Every women I’ve connected with who has suffered and survived an abusive relationship is a beautiful-hearted, compassionate, kind, SMART, Loving, resourceful, and strong human being. People who are abused tend to be trusting and open, which make them often easy prey for abusive and manipulative personalities. We don’t EXPECT people to hurt us, we see the best in people, we believe in Love and the ability of a person to grow and improve themselves. People who are abused are some of the kindest, most Loving souls. I know this now. I’m grateful for the lesson. I’m grateful for the authentic connections I’ve made through all this. Someday I dream of meeting in person all the women who were ever victimized by the man who hurt me, looking into their eyes, and embracing them in a hug that I’ll hold as long as they want me to. I feel so much LOVE for these women, and for every person who’s been through something similar. There are a LOT of you out there. For everyone else, think twice before you judge someone in a situation that you know nothing about. Until you have walked another’s path, you are ignorant and cannot speak to their choices or their experience. And like the picture says, we’ve all done things in our lives for which other people can judge us. What’s that bible verse... pull the plank out of your own eye...? (Yeah I know it. Just reminding you to think about it.) A good practice is to check yourself every time you start to place judgment on someone else ❤️
comments: |#dontjudge #weareequal #stayinyourlane #compassion #abuse #trauma #relationships #mentalillness #love #kindness #judgment #forgiveness #lifecoach  #lifelessons #grateful #humbled|True!

text:
Ich lebe nun seit mehr als einem Jahr vegan und überlegte lange ob ich etwas aus dem Trailer von #dominion posten sollte. In diesem einem Jahr fühlte ich mich oft ausgegrenzt und verurteilt. Wie kannst du nur Vegan Leben? Es gab und gibt nur eine Antwort: Ich will nicht dass ein Lebewesen für mein Leben leiden muss! 
Dominion war der ausschlaggebende Punkt. So drastisch. So konsequent und so ehrlich zeigt keine Dokumentation, wie sehr wir nicht nur unserer Welt schaden, sondern auch Tiere foltern, quälen und hinrichten. Nur um zum Abendbrot das Brot mit Salami zu belegen und zur neuen Netflix-Serie die Gummibären zu verschlingen. 
Ich stoße immer noch auf Unwissenheit und Intoleranz, weil viele denken, dass ich jedem zum Veganismus zwinge. Ich zwinge niemanden, aber ich bin ein Mensch. Und als Mensch habe ich eine Aufgabe. Die Wahrheit zu zeigen. Dominion zeigt die Wahrheit. Und deshalb hab ich mich entschlossen wenigstens einen Teil vom Trailer zu zeigen. Mittlerweile gibt es den Film auf Deutsch. Kostenlos! Auf YouTube! 
Vielleicht halten mich wieder einige für verrückt, aber das ist mir egal. Wenn nur eine Person sich diesen Film anschaut, bin ich stolz auf diesem Post. Entscheidet selbst:

Link zur deutschen Fassung von Dominion:
https://youtu.be/V7DrljVAaYk

We Are All The Same 
#dominionmovement #tierschutz #govegan #govegan🌱 #youtube #vegandeutschland #veganwerdenwaslosdigga #eatplantsnofriends #weareequal  #tierrecht #nahrung #animalrights #animalliberation #petadeutschland #dokumentation

text:
We label people like they are merchandise, to be sold at auction - but we are not objects to class, to store away in drawers to make life easier... If we have to put a label on everyone, we better have 8 billion, because there is one unique name for each...
It doesn't matter the color of your skin, the person you love, the god you pray, or the nation you pledge allegiance to - that defines why you can and cannot become... The only limit to your freedom is that of which you set... Do not allow the labels society was built on determine your tomorrow - be who you want, be who you please...
We should all work together not against one another as the challenges that await are not one of a select few, but ones that concern every han living here, from the old to the young, for the boys and girls, for the rich and poor, everyone is concerned... The environmental disaster that's upon us doesn't care for borders, for wealth, for age nor ideology, it is affecting us every second... If in this time of crisis, we still see humanity and animals as merchandise and objects, then we are in no way "wise men - Homosapiens" but are still neanderthals... #humanproblems #humanright #humannature #human #humanity #crisis #environment #education #change #voiceforchange #lifequotes #standup4humanrights #wearehuman #weareequal #photography #church #wakeup #progress #quotesaboutlife #motivation #inspiration #urbanphotography #urban #history

text: Knappt så att man kan sova inför morgondagens parad. Så peppad! Men! Prideveckan och paraden är inte bara en tid då stan fylls med glädje och kärlek. Det är viktigt att komma ihåg varför vi gör detta. Vi lever fortfarande i en tid där HBTQI- personer lever sitt liv i skräck och ständigt utsätts för hot och trakasserier. I vissa länder är till exempel homosexualitet förbjudet och straffbart med döden. En tanke värd att tänka på. Det är pridevecka denna vecka, men varje dag måste vi göra vad vi kan för att alla ska få leva lika. Det kommer jag göra. Alltid. 🏳️‍🌈 #weareequalse #weareequal #pridestockholm #stockholmpride #loveislove #loveisequal #equality

text:
“ My feminine side to me is how I prefer to show who I am as I know I am/I identify as a female and am proud of who I am! I have tried the tomboy and short hair style but it just wasn’t me, dressing feminine helps me feel more like who I really am. I know that because I don’t fit the typical stereotype of a girl who likes girls has made it difficult to find a girl. Many times I’ve tried talking to girls and have been rejected because I “don’t look gay enough” or they “don’t trust bi girls” which I don’t think is fair. I find the LGBTQ+ community deals with enough discrimination, and I don’t think we should be doing it to each other! I think we need to work on including our own community more before we can be mad at others for judging us as well.” •
Check out this beautiful femme @shemeltsaway
🏳️‍🌈 Want to be featured? DM us what being a femme, or your feminine side, means to you ! This brand is not about labels, it is about embracing a part of who you are without facing harassment or hate. It is about being able to be comfortable with who you are no matter what you choose to wear. There is no such thing as looking too gay or not gay enough. We invite all lgbtq+ members that are feminine or have a feminine side to them, to reach out and tell us what it means to you. 🏳️‍🌈

text:
The day is foggy here in Berlin.
I call a @uber and the uber driver was very fast. I enter in the car and 10mts after we start his working, we were stop by the police because he just open the window and press a button in the car panel. The @polizeiberlin argue he was one the phone doing a call. He wasn't! 
They stop the car almost 15minutes during my way back to airport and they were rude. Other uber cars pass through us, pressing the phone buttons and the polizei didn't act. 
I told them that the guy wasn't on the phone and we try to show them the uber record. And you know what? They told me to fuck off because they didn't care. Isn't their problem. 
Interesting point: Bassam, Uber driver, is from Palestine and having a big beard with shaved head, like me (I've less beard).
Sum up: berlin police send me to fuck off just because I ask them if we can move forward because I have a flight? Really? This how you approach people that don't talk German? Why you have biased people doing this job, jeopardizing who are working just for free? 
@Uber you should understand how your drivers in Berlin are losing money and customers because the Polizei stop the cars when the drivers accept the travel orders.
#uber #polizei #berlin #palestine #dontbebiased #equalrights #weareequal #humanrights #instapic #picoftheday #german #fightracism

text:
Most of my posts deal with food or baking but the larger world affects me and us. I was walking over the last weekend and angrily rehashing the Presidents latest tweet storm aimed at citizens of the USA (and the world) who he deems as less than human. 
How should one respond to these comments? How does a citizen with no power respond meaningfully? We MUST speak out about racism and dehumanizing comments and when I saw this collection of flags proudly showing the inclusion of the “other” I could not help but take image and want to share #nomoreracism #nomorediscrimination #weareallhuman#stopthetweets#nohatehere#supporteachother#loveislove#endracismnow#acceptance #rainbowflag#rainbow#pride#endracism#nomoreracisttweets#enough#weareequal#equalrightsforall#iphonephotography #whatisee#whatiponder

This world would be so much better if ppl could only open their eyes into matters that really count. Last night i stressed my mind out about how miserable i feel when i see how ppl lost their paths, their dignity, their dreams. You should stop going by the trend and make your own path. This cruel misconceptions and internet viral stuff takes out all the humanity left inside of us. Ppl are so busy to run after popularity, money, followers. In the end of the day none of this will actually stay with you or make you feel  peaceful. Ppl forget so easily they used to be simple, they run after succes like its some kind of status that permits you to live in here. Wake up, you have been born with the right to live your life and you are already succesful without being some kind of millionaire or popular vlogger bla bla. Internet opened so many of way for ppl who doesnt even have any talent or life experience to make themselves “popular” just by making fun of trivial stuff and blind brains actually like it cuz so that’s the trend😪. If you want something nice in life start to treat yourself nice and take care nicely of the ppl around you who actually care about even when u are nothing . I learnt you cannot achieve true succes without working hard or fight truly for what you believe in. You don’t need to compete with others cuz your place is already yours anyway. The world makes us turn our back on each others when love and compasion should be the key in surviving better and get along..start appreciate more of what is fragile and unique and strong not what ppl make fun of or show the others through their phones. Beside that full account of cool pictures etc most of them are empty and have nothing to offer to anybody. Selfish people will never get it in the end..this is our ruin right now..everyone think is better than someone else but in the end we are all equal! #hateloverelationship #mikachu #thought #mylife #advice #world #wise #appreciatelife #iexist #worldwide #betterlife #itsuptoyou #change #model #lost #weareequal #thoughtsinwords #instaquote #modelinseoul

text:
Mental health in itself is a taboo for many  and for especially for men accessing mental health help or even express their feels seem against cultural expectations. However, slowly we are trying to break the chain of stereotypes and stigma.

On July 28, 2019 we had a wonderful experience with our campaign on “Men's Mental Health Awareness:-#MardKoBhiDardHotaHai~ Boys Do Cry” for which there was great participation from all walks of life and appreciation to highlight the issue🌟♥️ We are thankful to @raahgiri_day to support us every time 😁😁😁 Here are some snippets of our AWARENESS WALK; the PLAY focusing on emotional blockages in various stages of life which ultimately effects the mental health faced by Men as well like pressure of being the only breadwinner with no say to their career, gender stereotypes, stopping from expressing, frustrations, aggression etc.; FLASH MOB to help motivate the audience to give chance to grow healthy; ACTIVITIES conducted post-play focusing on breaking the stereotype of expressing their feelings; and ending on a positive note through a POETRY written and recited by team member! 
A huge congratulations to the each and every member of team MANSA for the appreciation by the audience who lend an open mind and positive words to spread more awareness✨💐 #MANSAforMentalHealthAwareness 
#Speakout #Reachout #Endthestigma
#mardkobhidardhotahai  #MensMentalHealth #mentalhealthforall #mentalhealthawareness #campaign #gurgaon #raahgiri #fightforemotionalexpression #weareequal #wearehumans #letsupporteachother

text:
Hey my loves, just your overly nice transfemme drag dumpster fire checking in to let you know I'm done being sweet and kind for no reason. If you shit on my family, friends, or ANYONE FOR NO FUCKING REASON OTHER THAN YOUR BIGOTRY, I'm gonna call your ass out. I watch too many people get shunned, hurt or killed for being themselves. I'm not about to let a cis white gay man degrade a member of my family because you don't see the value (financially or even as a human) of the person you are choosing to take a shit upon.

We fight for acceptance too. Just because you can survive in this world without too many questions doesn't mean you can start being part of the problem. Don't forget, white cis gays are still "less than" to many people. 
I'm still a sweetheart, shit on me. Cool, I'm a big girl. I've lived through worse. But my community, my FAMILY are entitled to respect. And I will fight and bleed till they have it in equal amounts.

text:
Is it just me or does it seem like everywhere we look on social media we are told we are in need of self improvement and that we should surround ourselves with high value individuals who share our beliefs and goals (even though last I checked, we were all equal)? From what I can tell, this mostly results in a society where we are all reinforcing each other's point of view and patting each other on the back for being really amazing.

This has made me think about my personal goals for self-improvement. I will strive to always keep learning from every single person I encounter, new activity I try and each moment in general and to be as grateful, kind, generous, empathetic and happy as possible while I do it... oh, and to avoid anyone who refers to themselves as a high value individual at all costs. 😉
comments: |#weareequal #selfimprovement #donttakeyourselftooseriously #personalgrowth #randomthoughts #sunset #beautifulbc

Education is a fundamental human right.
No matter our origins, our color, our orientation, our financial situation, our social situation - having access to school, to a place of knowledge is essential for the development of a stronger youth, of a stronger society, ready to combat the problems we face together as one...
Having access to these locations is not a privilege and not should this ever become the case, it is a right for all humans to go to school and learn what they want... It is a priceless right... Much like food and water, housing and electricity... How can we seek a unified society if we cannot allow those who walk tomorrow the opportunity to analyze yesterday to build tomorrow... Education should be accessable to all, free for all - no matter the education course, and be of the upmost quality to ensure that we give all the keys to our future... It doesn't matter if your a child from the top 1% or one who had to flee a warzone, you are entitled to the same quality of education... This is basic human rights, and should not be a question or a concern in the first place... It is time to change our views and start giving the keys to our young to help us find solutions to our problems that plague our everyday life... #education #raiseyourpencil #human #humanright #standup4humanrights #inclusion #everydayactivism #weareequal #together #help #knowledge #sdg #sdg4 #globalgoals
comments: |Totally agree. Education allows the formation of critical thinking that is important to guarantee the rights of everyone. 💪👌😊

text:
We are ALL equal. No race, gender, sexuality, religion, belief or background is greater then the others. Everyone is equal. Everyone deserves a good and happy life. We are ALL human beings with families, friends, beliefs, memories, and lives of our own. Why is it so hard to understand this? We all breathe oxygen, require food and water to survive, want companionship and love. We are emotion filled human beings who respond to our surroundings in a good or bad way. We are all equal. It pains me to see such ignorance from people who have so much hate in their hearts. I just wish that more people were able to love one another instead of having such envy and hate.
☆~~~~~~~~~~☆
Sending blessings and love to everyone who reads this whether you need it or not 🌿🌙🔮
☆~~~~~~~~~~☆
#equality #weareequal #loveyourself #witchy #wiccan #love #peace #happiness #youareloved #spiritual #universe

text:
I love that we all fly through this crazy awesome life a little differently. That we are all unique and wonderful in our own perfect way. I love that if I don’t let my mind get involved and just stay true to my own path that my flight feels so much more full and vibrant. That judging based on what everyone else is doing doesn’t make it better. In fact it hinders my progress. To just let myself fly! Try it. Try doing a pose, a climb, dancing or anything you feel like doing and pretend like no one is watching. Just do it for you! Way different!!
🌟🌟
It’s a practice....
🌟🌟
I’m not saying that we can’t seek inspiration from others. It can be quite inspiring to see what others are up to...however,  it is important to honor ourselves and our own path.  Listen to ourselves..deep inside. To allow ourselves to find our own way. To be happy where we are..we need to learn to love ourselves for who we are and love everyone else for their awesome unique rad ness too. Then we can work together to make some really cool things happen! Seriously!..
🌟🌟
Happy Monday everyone!! Happy journeys! .
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.

text:
BOOM 🙌🏾👊🏾 COMMUNITY is essential. However we must be mindful of where we seek support and how we identify what we are looking for. We often choose to seek connection from those unable to provide it to us when we are needing to heal parts of ourself. When you heal you are able to develop healthy affirming connections and recognize them when they are present in your life. 🦋
🦋
Reposted from @trauma_conscious_yoga_method (@get_regrann) -  The process of decolonizing my healing personally has included my remembrance of the truth and return to the practices of my ancestors. As a therapist, trained in the West, I had been persuaded that those who were "attention seeking" or "needy" - meaning needing external validation from society or their community, had some form of pathology. This aligns with our societal ideology that champions rugged individualism, competition, capitalism, and all the other isms. This however, is bullshit. .
Our brains and bodies are wired for tribal survival, community support and community validation. We need this. We thirst for it. We struggle to show it to one another in the West. And many of us are sick, lonely and hopeless because of this lack. .
Our ancestors survived in tight-knit, intimate, spiritually-driven community and each individual's purpose was validated and nourished. So fuck the idea that we are "attention-seeking" or "needy" if we desire what is innately human. .
Question what you know. .
#decolonizemyhealing #transformingthelegacy  #intergenerationaltrauma #racialtrauma #collectivetrauma #ancestraltrauma #historicaltrauma #resiliency #healing #yogaandsocialjustice #traumaconsciousyogamethod #blacklivesmatter #peopleoftheglobalmajority #dismantlethepatriarchy #dismantlewhitesupremacy #dismantleheteronormativity #weareequal #weareone #wakeup #woke #blackyogateacher #blackownedbusiness #blackwriter #yoginigofcolor #BIPOC #community #validation - #regrann
comments: |#truth|#truth|Learned something new) I’ve tried to train my brain to be big and bad and not care what anybody thinks of me but...low key I really do care 😌😂

Meet My Bestie, He's Kukku.
A Rabbit of Angora Breed.
I Love Him So Much & He Loves Me Too, We Are Good Friends.

text: I try not to tell people I meet for the first time I’m vegan, because I don’t want them to immediately judge and stereotype me, because it has happened a lot before. Also, I don’t think animals are people. Animals have feelings like us, but no they can’t really do all the same things, but that’s alright and they still deserve respect. Killing isn’t a personal choice, because the animal never volunteered to die to be eaten. Free will is something you have to willing choose though. Still if you aren’t vegan, I don’t think I’m better than you. All humans were created equally and I believe we all have dignity that can’t be taken away regardless of who we are and where we come from. #vegan #veganmemes #health #environment #ethics #yourchoice #govegan #notapersonalchoice #love #animals #stopanimalcruelty #veganism #veganmemes #weareequal #equality #animalsdeservebetter #animalsarefriends #friendsnotfood

text:
🍇These aren't ordinary grapes. These grapes are very special. You see, these grapes took 11 years to come to fruition, and they are a sign of the amazing things about to happen. 🍇 11 years ago, my dad and I decided to start a winery. He went to school and I bought land. And shortly after, I became deathly ill, went through an nasty divorce with a broken man, and sold the land. 🍇 5 years ago, my (new) hubby and I decided to revive my dream on his family land. We put up a fence, started buying plants, and had our friends teach us more. Then the distance between my house and my MIL's house became too short, and once again, we moved and gave up on my winery dream. 🍇 Three years ago on a trip to a winery, we impulsively purchased this plant. As Shabby Chick grew, I knew my winery was years away. And still is. 🍇 These grapes are a sign. It's harvest time. I have worked hard and long. I have carefully prepared myself; growing and stretching myself; never giving up. Not death, not illness, not hate, not doubt, and not sabotage has been able to keep me down for long. I believe we reap what we sow. I believe we choose our destiny. I believe my dreams are about to come true. I love the woman I have become and I deserve what is heading my way. 🍇 What are your dreams? What are you doing to make them come true? 
#manifestation #ladyboss
#dreamscometrue #nevergiveup

text:
#throwback to last Monday, when I conquer my 25th #highpoint!! Contrary to popular belief, #bearmountain is the highest summit in #Connecticut, but not the actual highpoint! To get to the highpoint, one must hike the #MountFrissell trail in #Massachusetts, hike to the summit, and then descend on the south slope to get to the marker on the state line. At this marker is CT’s highest point at 2,379ft. (~725m)! You can also take the trail an additional half mile to get to the tri-state marker between NY, MA, & CT! A total of 3 miles (~5km) RT & 1,000ft. elevation gain should not take longer than 3 hours to complete!! Although the trail is lined with mountain laurel - CT’s state flower - the overgrowth on the trail makes it difficult to navigate at times. 25 states down (NC GA MO SC AL MS VA TN AZ FL LA IL IN OH KY AR KS OK NM TX NH VT NY MA CT), 25 to go!!!!
.
As I try to do with most of my trips, I reflect on how grateful I am to have these opportunities! Unfortunately, this took me to the site of the deadliest grade-school shooting in US history. 27 people lost their lives at #sandyhook back in 2012. Funding for a permanent memorial is  in progress, but I hate to see us become so desensitized that we forget we have the power to prevent more of these atrocities from happening month after month, year after year! RIP little ones.
.
#dannygtravels 🌎🏃‍♂️ @highpointersclub #exploreamerica #usa 🇺🇸🇺🇸🇺🇸 #newengland #northeast #halfwaythere #takeahike #viewsfordays #selfie  #neverforget #weareone #weareequal #onelove #thankful 🙏
comments: |Wow breathtaking!! What an amazing view ! Thank you for the educational tidbits as well, I had no idea that one could hike up and meet at a tristate line ! So cool and yes I’m sure  seeing the beauty in Gods creation makes anyone feel small and so grateful for life! Keep it up Damn Daniel!! 😉🙌🏽

text:
Reposted from @erinmyluv -  This is something I haven't talked about yet but it's time i share our story because we aren't alone. We are often judged on first impressions, categorized as a "special needs" family & often we are seen differently. We fight along side of many others to prove that people with all different abilities belong with & are equal to their peers. But something just as important to us is the undocumented human rights of people & families just like us. We are just one family out of millions going through this.
This is our reality & so many others who don't have a voice. This past January Pablo left for work just as any other typical day. What we didnt know was ICE (immigration) was watching our apartment in search for someone else. Because of that they profiled Pablo, he was followed to work, stopped, and taken into custody. Yes he is undocumented & yes we had already been in the process since Elena was born of applying for his permanent resident card, but its definitely not a easy fast process like many think. We are thankful to our family & friends who called me early that morning to tell me what was happening, because of that our attorney was able to act fast and intervene in the process of deportation. Though Pablo was released that night in an agreement with ICE that he participates in a program. ISAP is a way of immigration to "keep track " of undocumented people while they are fighting there case and still being deported. The rawness is that he must wear a ankle bracelet and is tracked every step he takes. Let me say, Pablo has been here in the US for 19 years, longer than the time he spent in Mexico. This is his home, this is where he, like most people, want to stay and work and be with his family & watch his kids grow up. We are one of the lucky ones, he is here and we got to go back to our life as best we could for now. We get to enjoy having our family together as it should be. But there are many others who aren't as lucky.
#DontLookAway #FamiliesBelongTogether #KidsDontBelongInCages #LightsForLiberty #standupforwhatyoubelievein #love #changetheworldwithlove #weareequal #closethecamps #togetherwestand #nohumanisillegal

This is something I haven't talked about yet but it's time i share our story because we aren't alone. We are often judged on first impressions, categorized as a "special needs" family & often we are seen differently. We fight along side of many others to prove that people with all different abilities belong with & are equal to their peers. But something just as important to us is the undocumented human rights of people & families just like us. We are just one family out of millions going through this.
This is our reality & so many others who don't have a voice. This past January Pablo left for work just as any other typical day. What we didnt know was ICE (immigration) was watching our apartment in search for someone else. Because of that they profiled Pablo, he was followed to work, stopped, and taken into custody. Yes he is undocumented & yes we had already been in the process since Elena was born of applying for his permanent resident card, but its definitely not a easy fast process like many think. We are thankful to our family & friends who called me early that morning to tell me what was happening, because of that our attorney was able to act fast and intervene in the process of deportation. Though Pablo was released that night in an agreement with ICE that he participates in a program. ISAP is a way of immigration to "keep track " of undocumented people while they are fighting there case and still being deported. The rawness is that he must wear a ankle bracelet and is tracked every step he takes. Let me say, Pablo has been here in the US for 19 years, longer than the time he spent in Mexico. This is his home, this is where he, like most people, want to stay and work and be with his family & watch his kids grow up. We are one of the lucky ones, he is here and we got to go back to our life as best we could for now. We get to enjoy having our family together as it should be. But there are many others who aren't as lucky.
#DontLookAway #FamiliesBelongTogether #LightsForLiberty #standupforwhatyoubelievein #love #weareequal #closethecamps #togetherwestand #nohumanisillegal #thisisus #unite #stopseparatingfamilies #downrightperfect #worldchanger #worrier
comments: |I share this because I want others to know this is real and it is very much happening. Its happening to people you know even if they didn't speak up. Its happening all around us, your neighbor, friend, the person in line behind you. Kids are in cages, people and children are dying. I know we are not alone but let me tell you that there were many nights and sometimes still I felt alone. Preparing in my head how to tell my kids daddy is living someplace else. How to go on with our life missing the only one who understood our true family routine. Stand up for human rights. Stand up for what you believe in. Stand up for love. Children don't belong in cages. Stop separating families. Close the camps. No more raids.|I love you guys!! And many people judge without knowing what it’s like to being in our shoes living in fear everyday. I want you to know that I was in Pablo's shoes for a long time. I, like many others, was brought from my country as a child. Trying to escape a civil war and a violent abusive father, looking for a better future. It's been almost 30 years now and thanks to my wife I've never had to hide again for a long time. It's a horrible feeling to be in his shoes, but God is good and he's gonna take care of him. No good member of this society, undocumented or not should go through this. I'm so hopeful for your family. Stay strong.❤️|❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️|❤️❤️❤️You are an inspiration!! So many are backing you and fighting for you and families like yours!  #betoorourke #envoysforbeto|Amén!

text:
Article 26 Everyone has the human right to education including free and compulsory elementary 
education and human rights education.

It's hard to understand for someone like me who has had the privilege to grow up in Finland well known for its good education system that in many other countries education is not a guarantee. Especially not for girls... I guess that I just have to accept and understand that I cannot fully understand. Not now, not after. We can try to understand as good as we can but I think it's important to admit that no matter the facts, we can never argue that we fully understand another human's growth and life. Whether you have grown up in the same country, same city or even same family. Don't you think? 
Thank you @christina_noor__ for posting this human right and for letting me draw you! 🙏💕 #womensrightsmatter #educationmatters #girlsrights #treatgirlsright #righttoeducation #educationiskey🔑 #girlsrightsarehumanrights #fuckinjustice #humankind #weareequal #nomatterwhat #peoplearepeople #letgooffear #prejudices #facingyoumanity #störstavalltärkärleken #drawdrawdraw #drawart #peace #muotokuva #beginnerart #frihet #freedom #rättvisa #rättighet #fairness #jämställdhet #equalityforall #womensrightsarehumanrights #humanrightseducation

text:
Durante anos vivi com a culpa de sentir muito, sentir demais, ser sensitiva ou até hiper sensível no que toca a relações humanas. 
Hoje, continuo a ‘sentir muito’ por sentir muito, mas ainda mais sinto pelos que sentem pouco ou nada. 
A minha vida pode ser uma montanha russa mas ao menos não é cinzenta, os sentimentos continuam a ser a minha bússola interior. Quando estou triste, carrego a depressão às costas mas quando a moeda muda de face sou envolta por um fogo de artifício sorridente que faz tudo valer a pena. 
A astrologia diz que sou Balança e de facto, sou uma balança que pende tanto para um lado como para outro, mas sem nunca perder a integridade e enfrentando com o peito aberto o dia de amanhã com a certeza que o vou sentir na totalidade do meu eu físico e mental. 
Muito amor,
Sofia .
.
.
#myheadspacewriter #headspacewriter #myownwords #freedomsong #psychology #societyfeelings #weareequal #expressyourself #risetogether
comments: |❤️|✨|It’s all about perspective, and we live in world where the average thinks vulnerability is a sign of weakness, but I agree that is a strength, the average makes lot of noise and likes to talk even though they don’t fully comprehend and that maybe alienates the quiet ones. “As gold is purified in the fire, so the soul is purified in suffering.” Philosophy of Søren Kierkegaard|🙏🏻💙

text:
What makes me equal to the person next to me? What makes me equal to a person in another continent? What makes me equal to a person that belongs to another religion? What makes me equal to a child? What makes me equal to every human being in this planet? .
Our smile. We all smile in the same language. We don’t need words to smile, we don’t need money to be able to smile, we don’t need to believe in God, or to be a specific gender. We can all smile and it’s the best way to communicate with other people.  The smile opens the heart.
.
.
.
#weareequal #weareequals #weallsmile #smileforeveryday #borntotraveltheworld #connectingpeople #wearepeople #openheart

text:
MLK was a true leader, one who believed violence was not the answer and who explained in a speech why the founding of this country is important to EVERYONE .
.
Martin Luther King - July 4th, 1965
.
...”I still have a dream this morning: (Yes) one day all of God’s black children will be respected like his white children...... .
.
“We hold these truths to be self-evident that all men (All right) are created equal, that they are endowed by their Creator with certain inalienable Rights, (Yes, sir) that among these are Life, Liberty, and the pursuit of Happiness.””
.
Thank you to MLK and those throughout history who have led with kindness and grace. I share this dream and hope it will one day be realized. I continue to have hope for this country on this Independence Day 2019.

No body wins when we throw shade at each other. 
We only succeeded when we honor [our] journeys, honor [our] path, honor [our] obstacles, and EMBRACE what lies ahead. 
Our lives are each our own; we own them by how we choose to act & react. 
By leaning over someone else’s flame to smother their fire, your flame does not grow brighter. 
None of us are perfect and the ego is strong, but each time you reflect and choose to do no harm, to follow YOUR truth; you’re one step closer to finding some of those good energy vibes that will allow your flame to burn bright and strong. ...
...
...
Choose your energies wisely🕉

text: 🤬 My whole life, I've heard, "Girls can't do that!" "Women don't act like that!" And "What will people think?" 🎖️At the ripe old age of 14, I traveled 1500 miles from Montana to Alabama to attend military school. By choice. I wanted more. I wanted a better education. Military school in the 1990's wasn't always kind to the 10% female population. We didn't have female uniforms, female sports, and at times, being a girl was something I needed to "overcome." 🤠 My son recently turned 14, and the generational lapse struck me. I now reflect differently on this time period. I'm reminded that I am so very brave. Seriously? What kind of kid WANTS to go to military school 1500 miles from home? Me. Me who is brave. Me who set out 25 years ago to build the life I wanted. Me, who leaps at opportunities. Me. 😇 I'm so grateful for the leaps I've taken in my life, even the ones where I smacked the ground on impact. I have failed many times, but I am satisfied knowing I've leapt more than I've failed. I'm grateful I never cared what people thought. I'm grateful I was brave. ♥️♥️ What brave thing have you done? ♥️♥️ #survivor #metoo #momboss #momlife #womanownedbusiness #womenempowerment #madeinoklahoma #authentic #ownit #thefutureisfemale #sisterhood  #weareequal #cleaning #cleanhouse #laundry #cleanliving #greenlife #farmlife #greenclean #bestself #believe #changeisgood #betterliving #natural #pure #honest #livelaughlovelife #boss #mom #womanstyle

We have the power to believe and to creat our world a better place.All it takes is to look at humanity like you would yourself no money no objects will make others better than you. text:
♥️Hi! Let me introduce myself and tell you why I do what I do! My name is Amber Malcom, recovering Attorney turned natural product maker (now manufacturer). ⚖️ About a decade ago, I became ill- I mean 10% chance of survival ill. Over 72 days in the hospital, 12 major operations, and 5 years of recovery, I finally starting getting better. I started taking accountability for my own body. I was on gobs of pills and I really didn't want to rely on them. 🐐 My handsome hubby, affectionately known as Shabby Hunk, and I wanted a "natural as possible" lifestyle. We began to research, bought a farm, and started homesteading. We raised our own food, learned to make all sorts of stuff that I thought grew in stores, and set about getting rid of unnecessary and unhealthy chemicals. 🏡 I started remodeling our old, dirty farm house- The cleaners' stench would run me out of the house! So I started buying "green" cleaners, only to be unsatisfied. I hate Cleaning, I don't want to do more work. So I started making my own. I had 2 criteria for every invention: 1. It MUST work better than my toxic cleaners; and 2. It must be 100% natural. 🏆 4 years later, my products have been clinically tested to out preform leading brands; are still 100% natural; we have been featured on the Home Shopping Network, won the Small Business Association's Entrepreneurial Success Award, the InnovatHer Women in Business Challenge, and the SCORE Small Business Championship. 🤗 Hang out with me and I will encourage you to do amazing things with your life too! 
#momboss #momlife #womanownedbusiness #womenempowerment #madeinoklahoma #authentic #ownit #thefutureisfemale #sisterhood  #weareequal #cleaning #cleanhouse #laundry #cleanliving #greenlife #farmlife #survivor #metoo #greenclean #bestself #believe #changeisgood #betterliving #natural #pure #honest #livelaughlovelife #boss #mom #womanstyle

text:
Took this photo July 15th 2016 and I’m not sure how I feel that this statement is something we are still trying to bring awareness to or understand as to why it’s so easily tossed out the window.
.
Colors aside: We are all humans.
.
✖️We are all equal in the fact that we are all different. We are all the same in the fact that we will never be the same. We are united by the reality that all colours and all cultures are distinct & individual. We are harmonious in the reality that we are all held to this earth by the same gravity. We don't share blood, but we share the air that keeps us alive. I will not blind myself and say that my black brother is not different from me. I will not blind myself and say that my brown sister is not different from me. But my black brother is he as much as I am me. But my brown sister is she as much as I am me.✖️- [@cjoybellc]
.
On this day, July 4th, when we talk so much about freedom and independence, let’s also remember the many that don’t have that same liberty, in the US and around the world, simply by the color of their skin. When in fact, we are all human and should be treated as such.
.
#MaestroShowUpToBlowUp #day4 @themovementmaestro

text:
“A strong woman looks a challenge in the eye and gives it a strong wink “ •
•
We are all going through challenges, no woman is above another, wether you have a degree, wether your a millionaire, wether your a stay at home mom, wether you have 1 -10 jobs, kids no kids, we all are beautiful, we all are strong, we all live the life we want, and do as much or as little for the things that we want to accomplish, sometimes it takes months for some, and for others years, but we all have a different belief in what a successful life looks like , and your form of success doesn’t define me, nor any one around you, all I see now a days are stupid posts of always only woman comparing each other , like why ? I don’t understand and never will , #weareequal #lovehumanity #loveeachother  #rants

text:
For more check out https://www.facebook.com/2385081251520502/posts/2680452468650044?s=1384373112&v=e&sfns=mo “When obstacles arise, you change your direction to reach your goal; you do not change your decision to get there.”~ Zig Ziglar

We have seen many ups and down since last Sunday to this Sunday to reach our goal, BUT we stood ground and Perseverance pays!!! June 30th, 2019 was a wonderful experience of the event on LGBTQIA+ Mental Health Awareness for which there was great participation and appreciation🌟♥️ We are thankful to @raahgiridaygurgaon to support us every time and now giving us an open invitation to conduct atleast one session each month😁😁😁 Here is a clip of our event with clips of our AWARENESS WALK, snippets of the NUKKAD NATAK sharing about different mental health issues faced by thr community like bullying, homelessness, exclusion, discrimination, anxiety, depression, fear etc.. POSITIVE AND IMPORTANT MESSAGE SHARED BY DR. SHWETA SHARMA🌈🌈🌈🌈 We will soon share our nukkad natak showcasing the entire message as well the efforts of our participants ♥️ A huge congratulations to the each and every member of team MANSA for an overwhelming appreciation by the audience who lend an open mind and positive words to spread more awareness✨❤️🧡💛💚💙💜 #MANSAforMentalHealthAwareness 
#Speakout #Reachout #Endthestigma #lgbtqia #mentalhealthawareness #campaign #gurgaon #raahgiri #lgbt #weareequal #wearehumans #letsupporteachother

text:
Till today with my experience I have never found a person happy with his/her body who got teased by somebody earlier. Sadly, it's the most in our country that every person is treated with bias for their natural body type. Every fat girl that is teased for her being fat, how she feels trust me nobody has a clue. That “perfect” body that models have to have in order to be a model proves our obsession with zero figure. Don't believe me? This is how people refer fat people- an elephant, potato, couch and so many other names. If you call somebody with such names and think this is funny then do you have a count of how many times you have put somebody down, played with somebody's self-esteem, made somebody cry.You might not feel the biggie in being called with such terms BECAUSE it doesn't affect you as you're not fat. In TV serials no guy wants to date a fat girl and fat people are always shown binge eating, lazy, eating junk, foodie and you will rarely find any romantic scene of a fat person romancing,because of it the insecurities that people have with their bodies is disheartening. People still trying to find a diet that can change their size.
(CONTINUE BELOW)
.
.
.#bodyshaming #feminism #fatshaming #skinnyshaming #wordpower #writer #neverless #weareequal #dark #fat #skinny #stereotypes #society #mindset #feminist #equality #equalrights #weareallequal #youandmeareequal #neversettle #awareness #positivity #pride #public #standupcomedians #body #mybodymychoice #bodypositivity #liveandletlive #insecurities
comments:
|Being comfortable in your body is not easy, because people will make you notice 20 different reasons why your body type is less appealing and you should change yourself, but they will never tell you even one reason that they find appealing about you in real because WE humans cannot survive confident people around us, we only get confident when others are less confident than us and that makes us a superhero because we can outshine the less confident people in the crew. I'm fed up of seeing people taking supplements to get fat and saying we're trying to be healthier. Lol, who are you making fool, me or yourself? If you wanted to be more healthy you would exercise, eat healthy, lead a healthy lifestyle but no you're taking supplements on which slogans are very healthy such as “weight gain”. Do you know what's the mentality of a fat girl, that insecurity and fear in her mind while passing a group of judgemental people, there's a constant fear in her mind that at least they don't make fun of me today. I feel so sorry for myself to be a part of such generation who think making fun of people's body is cool. Unless and until it doesn't happen with us it seems cool to us and the minute it happens we feel disrespected. Being fat or skinny is not a problem but when people call us with such terms we feel offended, even if we're comfortable with our bodies because they say that to offend you, to put you down and when someone says something to put you down you feel disrespected. There can be two different people calling you fat but with different intentions, somebody saying it WITHOUT the intention of putting you down and somebody saying it to put you down. Just because somebody is skinny doesn't mean they are malnourished and just the way if somebody is fat doesn't mean they don't let others eat their part. It's high time that we raise the standard of our jokes and stop saying rubbish about other's body. It's their body so their concern, they should be the ones worried about it every time and not us, I don't know what pleasure we get by putting out the obvious things about them with hard hitting words.|Do you know fat individuals are married less often than normal weight individuals. Also, assumption of somebody's personality and traits based on their bodies is wrong(i.e he/she is fat that means they are lazy, they exercise less often). Teachers in school without any hesitation make fun of fat students. In one survey, preschool children reported that average size children are given more preference in plays, lead roles, dance performances.
Statements like “she's too fat to be an actress” why size should be our consideration in an actor/actress? and why not the acting abilities. Fat girls are often told not to wear short dresses, bikini, tops because their curves will make them look odd and everyone's eyes would be on them for that reason.
Statements like “she's too lucky, she got married with such handsome groom even after her being fat” shows our stereotypical thinking for fat bodies. Also, we should report ads like “pehle mein mota tha tab meri zindagi dukhi chal rahi thi mera koi dost nahi tha phir maine xyz khaya jisse mai mota hogaya aur ab mere dost hai” pisses the hell out of me.|Also, the subject of stand up comedians our always fat/dark. They say all the offensive and harsh things especially to this category of people. Just because you're falling out of content doesn't mean you will say anything in the name of freedom of speech. All the speakers either they're poets or even stand up comedians, their words have an IMPACT. There are a lot of things about which Indian Janta can have a laugh, so try something new, targeting a category of body is extremely bias of y'all who do this. Also, In schools teachers perceive that fat individuals work more poorly compared to average weight students in the first look and give lesser attention to fat children. A national survey found that individuals who are overweight reported a three times higher livelihood to be denied medical care than the average weight people. They are hired less often for jobs, they have greater termination rate than average weight individuals. Their psychological health also suffers:
they have lower self esteem, lower self concept, higher rates of depression and anxiety disorder, suicidal thoughts and what not. Weight based teasing associated with higher rates of binge eating and unhealthy weight control such as fasting, self induced vomiting,diet pills, skipped meals and smoking.|I don't endorse being unhealthy but I definitely can't support people making fun of a category of body for having a laugh because I don't find it to be funny, I don't understand people encouraging their closed ones to change themselves to be loved by the world. Fat is also aesthetically beautiful, sexually attractive, you should draw fat people, you should see fat people, you should date fat people, you should desire fat people because fat people are beautiful and worthy and NORMAL and they too deserve to be termed as attractive and desirable. They don't need to change themselves, we need to change our mindset. People who think fat people are the most unsuccessful, hopeless, weak willed, lazy people are themselves that way, because they are so lazy that they're not allowing their thinking to grow and a person without growth is weak willed and unsuccessful and therefore hopeless.
What can we do to stop body shaming?
Confront the people who perpetuate body shaming, and tell them that others have feelings too and they also feel bad. As I always say it's just the role of thinking, if you want to see beauty in sombbody you will find beauty ( like her smile is so beautiful) and if you want to find somebody ugly you will notice ( oh, god her face is filled with pimples, marks and what not.) IT'S JUST THE ROLE OF PERSPECTIVE.|💞|Yess 👏👏 🔥

☝🏻"Jilbabku dan jubahmu bukanlah sekat untuk tidak bersaudara" - Dewi Praswida, Penerima Beasiswa Nostra Aetate.

Foto ini mendadak viral. Perjumpaan sederhana yang tak biasa. Sebab tak seperti foto antar umat Katolik dan pemimpinnya, foto ini jadi terlihat istimewa. Foto seorang muslimah dari negeri dengan mayoritas berpenduduk muslim dan pemimpin milyaran umat Katolik dunia. 
Penegasan Dewi soal identitasnya adalah wujud penegasan akan harmoni kehidupan antar umat beragama meski secara iman berbeda. Dewi yang merupakan aktivis Gusdurian dari Jawa Tengah membawa wajah rahmat semesta alam pada Bapa Suci dan begitu sebaliknya ia mendapatkan senyum kasih untuk uluran tangan persaudaraannya.

Betapa indah ..🙏

#weareequal #godisgood #peace #love #peaceispossible #peaceisbeautiful #peaceispriority #embracing #brotherhood #standindifference #kitasama #persaudaraan #damai #kasih #indahnyaperbedaan #pacem #deus #bonusestdeus

SENTIMIENTOS ENCONTRADOS... ...es lo que hay cuando por un lado vemos todo el apoyo que se está dando a la búsqueda de igualdad, al apoyo a que nadie debe de ser juzgado o maltratado por ser o sentirse diferente a los demás o a lo considerado normal. 
Cada vez son más las personas y empresas que hacen su apoyo públicamente pero esto también trae consigo una ola de comentarios tan ignorantes o sin fundamento que solo dan cólera, rabia, impotencia, y muchas cosas más.

Comentarios como “por que el orgullo? Un hombre nunca se sintió orgulloso de ser hombre por serlo”, “nunca más tambo, alianza lima, Sheraton”, “Rosquetes, maricones, enfermos mentales, pedofilos”. Estos y otros más solo demuestran que estamos demasiado atrasados como sociedad, que nos falta mucho por madurar, y hay mucha desinformación para ser más empaticos y tolerantes.

Pero, aunque puedan ser difíciles de leer u oír, esto nos hace querer con muchas más ganas y fuerza salir a demostrar que somos como todos, y valemos mucho por ello. Así también poder ayudar a demostrar a los que aún viven en las sombras que está bien ser diferente, que está bien aceptarse como uno es, que no hay sentimiento más gratificante que mirarte al espejo y estar feliz con el reflejo, y que sobretodo recordarte que NADIE tiene derecho a quitarte ese sentimiento. 
Vales mucho y tienes mucho por ofrecer. Hemos avanzado mucho, pero aún hay mucho camino por recorrer. 
#pridelima2019 #lima #gay #gaypride #peru #proud #outandproud #lesbian #transgender #trans #weareequal #gayboy #gaylima

text:
Nina Cried Power is such an inspirational song, I highly recommend it, it's not only about standing up for what you believe in but the power of voice and how strong ones words can be. 
Hozier has inspired so many people with their powerful lyrics and lite up the world with his hit song: Take Me To Church.

The music video for Take Me To Church was surrounding a gay couple. The sad lyrics followed with the performance in the video showed the struggles of being openly gay and opened the eyes of our youth to how mistreated and unwelcomed the SAGA community is. 
Nina Cried Power and Take Me To Church are definitely my highest recommendation as songs to listen too along with many of Hozier's songs.

#music #Hozier #represent #protest #gayrights #loveyourself #standup #saga #freelove #humanrights #weareequal #peace #powerofmusic #freedom #equallove

text: I'm not feeling well and adding seeing all the senseless hatred, disrespect, bigotry and pain out there right now has given me so much heartache. We all need to remember that humans are humans, no matter where we come from, what we look like, who we love or what we believe. Act accordingly. Be kind to everyone. Make things better 🧡

text: With the aim to spread awareness about the mental health issues of the LGBTQ+ community, we marched forward to do just that! Step by step we moved towards making the imagined event a real success 🏳️‍🌈✨❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🏳️‍🌈✨ We wanted to highlight their struggles, hardships and pain and what it does their mental health. We are so grateful to receive the support and blessings of our mentors, hardworking volunteers and the genuinely interested audience at Delhi last but not the least a huge support from the @indianqueeralliance_ who helped us spread our message louder💖💖Here are some videos and photos of the event on 23.06.2019. However, this is not over yet people 😁We have a similar event planned for Gurugram at the end of this week!! We urge you all to continue showing your support and 🥰 for the cause -- to raise awareness about mental health🌺🤝🤝🤝 #reachout #speakout #endthestigma #lgbt #lgbtq🌈 #lgbtcommunity #mentalhealthawareness #campaign #weallarehumans❤ #weareequal #letssupporteachother

Life can be as sour as milk in a sippy cup left in a car in July. (Gross) 
As a wife, mother, and small business owner, life can get overwhelming. I've been down over a week  post surgery, and my personal life...yuck...there's some not fun stuff there. (Think 9 day laundry pile)

Sometimes I cry when I'm alone. Sometimes I get really down. Sometimes (a lot of times) I'm too hard on myself. But it's okay. I'm learning to cry it out and then get a plan. 
My feelings are real and just that- feelings. I'm learning every day to look around and pat myself on the back for what I've done right! It's similar to an exercise in gratefulness. Instead of listing all the things I've done wrong, I list all the things I've done right. 
This helps so much with my mom guilt. Everything  gives me mom guilt. One thing I do right for my family is using safe cleaning products. I pat myself on the back because (even if I forgot to feed the kids breakfast) I know that the cleaning products I use are powerful for me yet safe for them. 
How do you move past your own self criticism? What do you do to relieve mom guilt? 
#momboss #momlife #womanownedbusiness #womenempowerment #madeinoklahoma #authentic #ownit #thefutureisfemale #sisterhood  #weareequal #cleaning #cleanhouse #laundry #cleanliving #greenlife #farmlife #survivor #metoo #greenclean #bestself #believe #changeisgood #betterliving #natural #pure #honest #livelaughlovelife #boss #mom #womanstyle
comments: |yes, mom guilt is real! I often ask my husband if he thinks I'm, or we, are good parents, and he always says "if you have to the presence to ask that then you know that you are" and I try to apply that to mom guilt as well... you're already balancing a lot on your plate, no need to add guilt on top of that.  everyone is doing the best they can and as long as the kids are happy and healthy, all is good 💕|♥️|I think it’s good to feel the feelings. They are valid and it helps me to just go with the emotions. And then reflect on all that you accomplish every single day! I hope things get better for you soon - Sending all kinds of positive vibes your way! ❤️|I think we can all relate! It helps to focus on being grateful for the things that are good. Being alive, kids are healthy and knowing that hards times won't last forever. Be encouraged 💞|I can definitely relate it’s so important to celebrate your wins big or small , and allow ourselves to feel vulnerable when times aren’t as pleasant I’m hoping July will bring a much needed positive shift 💕😘|I totally agree, mom guilt is real!  But I think most of it is self imposed.  We are all doing the best that we can.  I used to feel guilty for not being a Pintrest mom.  But my kids where taken care of, happy and healthy.  Trust me they didn't care of I was the "perfect" mom, they loved me anyway.  Geaux easy on yourself, you are doing a great job!  And don't let ANYONE tell you any different.|Wow! What an uplifting quote and story. Thanks so much for sharing!|Always keep it real|Love this story!🙌

text:
Today's Affirmation:
We are all Human!

To me personally this is a very loaded statement. It's not secret the America's history is deeply woven with discrimination. We have no reason to hate another group of people for existing. 
Black? Human.
Hispanic? Human.
White? Human.
Straight? Human.
Gay? Human.
Transgender? Human.
Man? Human.
Woman? Human.
Child? Human.
Christian? Human.
Muslim? Human.
Celebrities? Human.
Our idols? Human.
Our parents? Human.
Our teachers? Human.
We are all human. We all make mistakes. We are all just trying to make it through this life. And we all like to think that we know more than we do, or that others know more than they so. Embrace the imperfections of being human, and remember and everyone is trying to figure out it just like you. Be kind, be loving, and lift other up on their journey!
We are all human!

#affimations #positiveaffirmations #affirmationoftheday #positivevibes #mantra #reminder #mindfulliving #mindfulreminder #weareallhuman #iamhuman #human #trustyourself #weareequal #equality #humanrights #youaremagic #tryingtofigureitout #trustyourintuition #livelife #livelifetothefullest #havecompassion #becompassionate #selfcompassion #pridemonth #enddiscrimination #loveeachother #findlove #unitycircle1 #justanotherbleedingheart

While we the black community are coping with the fact that we are being treated as minorities and being taken down each and everyday we are sitting here arguing about which skin complexity looks better....both are equally beautiful and unique....stop putting us against each other...that’s what’s wrong with the black community today....we fight among each other when we have bigger problems to worry about...how are we suppose to fight together as people if we can’t stick together.....Don’t tear each other down instead build your neighbor up....we all we got....were brothers and sisters....and it’s ok to have a preference but don’t bash people♥️Colorism is a big gap in the black community that separates us....we have to stop it now👏🏽
